"We'll wait until they arrive, before we conduct more business, but I'm sure the shopkeeper won't mind losing a little profit.

Tristan had been glowering at the captor from his chair, straining against his bonds in hopes of breaking free, but the effort made no impact on the strengthened rope. "You boys better leave," the shopkeeper growled. "Holding royal figures hostage is punishable by death," Tristan's threatening demeanor caught Fen off guard for a moment. before the thug let out a loose chuckle.

"I think we'll be alright," the captor said, "There are other high ranking figures in the kingdom who don't take kindly to the meddling of these two." The captor indicate toward the horse and prince. "But in any case, we will be using your shop as a temporary base of operations, so be a nice old man and quiet down."

Tristan grit his teeth, but seeing no other option, he held his tongue.

"Now all that's left to do is wait," Fen said, and with that conclusion, he went over to a table, sat down, and lowered his cowl over his eyes. The other three bandits quietly exchanged words over who held first watch, and then they each took their position.

Maximus watched the captors disperse through the shop over the horizon line of his belly, before laying a round cheek on the floor and drifting off to sleep.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------
Clunk. Clunk. Clunk. There was a heavy thudding on the door, and the captor on watch blearily went over, peered through the peep hole and then quickly opened the door. He politely, but hurriedly gestured for the newcomer to enter before shutting it behind them. A hastily scrawled 'Sorry Closed for the Day' was propped on the other side of the door to dissuade any unwanted intruders.

Maximus was quickly jolted by the thudding on the door and lifted his head with a start before realizing something was different about himself. At first he wasn't quite sure, and then it hit him, or rather buried him. He felt much heavier. His cheeks and neck sported a soft layer of lard on them that jiggled with each small movement. His legs, though asleep from being trussed for so long, also had a layer of padding that creased against the ropes that bound him. His belly was, thankfully, not anywhere near as tight as it had been the night before, but was several inches wider and bulged against his legs, pushing between is front and back legs and forming luscious love handles where it met the floor. The horse could only guess what his rear end looked like, but it had a poofy layer of padding that dipped one cheek onto the other from its on weight. Almost smothering his tail which seemed to be the only thing that had escaped from the dispersal of fat. Maximus was astonished by the rate at which he'd expanded, but almost felt a sense of delight in the feeling of plush softness and incredible weight.

Flynn and Tristan were also awoken by the sudden knocking, but they were quickly silenced by two of the bandits. They looked at each other nervously, but decided not to attempt anything for fear of causing unintentional consequences.

As he lay transfixed on his bulbous body, he completely forgot about the newcomer until he felt a strong pressure applied to his middle. A charcoal black forelock attached to a large hoof smushed into Maximus' belly, causing it to bulge outwards around the indentation. As Maximus looked up, he saw White Lightening standing over him. A smug look adorned the obsidian stallion's muzzle as he removed his hoof from Maximus' belly, initiating a series of rocking and waving ripples to spread out through the horse's fat-swamped stomach.

"As you can see," Fen said, "There are others who do not take kindly to your heroics." White Lightening glanced at the thug and nodded appreciatively. Snorting in approval, the horse looked back down at Maximus, with a malicious, but almost infatuated glint in his eyes.

The look sent a shiver through Maximus' obese body, and the horse began to sweat nervously from the possible indications of that unnatural expression.

"So," Fen said, breaking White Lightening out of his reverie. "When will your partner be here?" White Lightening gesture at the door, and then pawed at the floor once. "One hour?" Fen inquired, wanting to be completely sure that this was what the black stallion meant. White Lightening nodded in affirmation, before turning his attention back to Maximus. Intrigued, the stallion looked at Maximus, and then back at the pastry display. Noting the destructive state the first three rows, White Lightening realized that the other five were almost completely full. A sinister grin slowly split the charcoal horse's muzzle as he looked between the pastries and Maximus. Realizing White Lightening's intent, Maximus jerked in surprise, but also felt a slight desire as well.

Hmmmm. Maximus thought, perhaps this might be fun.

What happens next?
15511122211222211.title: White Lightening comes in and has a little hear...

choices: The Captain of the Guard who was in alliance with White Lightening
An Criminal Who knew Flynn from his thieving days
155111222112222111.content:
White Lightening's intentions were crystal clear to the bound horse, and Maximus faced them with a swirl of apprehension and intrigue. He was nervous from White Lightening's almost feral display of passion dancing in the dark horse's eyes, and yet, his heart (and stomach) seemed to yearn for more. The combination produced an exhilarating effect that sent Maximus' mind reeling.

Flynn must have sensed a hint of what White Lightening intended, because he called out to the stallion, "Whoa there buddy, what do you have in mind?" White Lightening flickered his eyes to the bound prince, and allowed the insidious grin to explain his wishes. With a snort, White Lightening turned back to the ample Maximus, with an almost unearthly focus. When Flynn attempted to intervene again, Fen stepped forward and raised his hand.

"Anymore words to distract the boss, and you'll be whistling through your teeth." The threat lingered in the air, as Flynn struggled between his protective nature over his equine friend, and the possibility of losing his teeth. Then his gaze landed on Maximus, whose visage bore elements of passion and an almost challenging attitude directed at the opposing horse. Flynn sighed, and dropped his head in defeat. There was nothing he could do, and anything he tried now would only result in harm inflicted upon his person or that of his friends.

Tristan simply sat still, and went quiet as he saw the same futility in the situation as Flynn, though he still kept his mind open and alert in case of any possible chance of escape.

Once the pair had gone quiet, Fen nodded toward White Lightening and the stygian horse snorted with the contentment that he could continue undisturbed. He bent forward and pressed his muzzle into the Maximus' gargantuan belly to gauge the emptiness and to revel in the soft, hypnotic sensation of the horse's flab. White Lightening then took an Apple Crescent from the fourth row of the first partition and proffered it to the stranded horse. The almost dainty manner in which White Lightening did so was both disarming and encouraging for Maximus. 'How bad could this be?' the white stallion thought to himself as he eagerly tongued the crescent into his eagerly awaiting mouth and bit down.

The tartness of the pastry triggered Maximus' almost uncontrollable love for apples. A mixture of fruit, flaky bread, and crisp sugar made that love turn to lust as the bloated stallion found himself wanting more with each second. White Lightening observed the stallion's eagerness and decided to forge on with a little more encouragement and pace. He grabbed another two pastries in his mouth and quickly proffered them to the bloated stallion. They disappeared as quickly as the first. White Lightening kept up the process until all twenty of the Apple Crescents were gone from the little wooden partition. Maximus' belly looked just as wobbly as before, though his face was caked in pastry debris.

White Lightening looked at the other 29 partitions, and realized that at this rate he would never be able to feed the stallion before his partner arrived. The observant stallion then realized that each wooden box was actually an individual crate/tray for the pastries. They would need to be removed for periodic cleaning and refills.Taking this into consideration, White Lightening snorted at Fen and made a small swooping gesture for him to come over. When Fen approached the black stallion, White Lightening gestured to the crate next to the Apple Crescents. a box of frosted eclairs, and motioned for it to be removed from the display.

Fen decided to not ask questions and obediently pulled the box from the shelf and placed on the ground next to Maximus' head. White Lightening nodded in appreciation and then motioned to Maximus to enjoy. The hungry equine didn't need to be told twice, and lifted his head to begin eating. White Lightening aided the bulging horse by shuffling the further eclairs closer towards the side of the box closest to Maximus' muzzle. Between each assist, White Lightening would nuzzle the stallion's abundant fat and gently nip at his love handles. The stallion's belly squished against the floor to form a defining bulge that outlined Maximus' expanding stomach.

The second box was gone in under 2 minutes, and while the presence of the pastries made a slight difference in Maximus' well-rounded size, it was minuscule to both him and White Lightening's eye. The raven-hued stallion realized that the placement of each partition in front of Maximus would only slow the process, so he motioned to Fen to grab another partition, but this time, White Lightening had him place the remaining four boxes on the floor, so that he could continue the process with less interruption.

Upon seeing White Lightening's idea, Maximus shivered once more. This time is was more out of joyous anticipation rather than anxiety. The movement resulted in the sloshing of his belly and the soft collision of his two, generously padded butt cheeks.

As each partition was set in front of him, Maximus found himself begin to get lost once again in a food-driven reverie reminiscent of the one he'd experienced the night before. With each pastry the horse downed, his yearning grew stronger; and with each partition, his stomach stretched a little more. His stomach swelled noticeably by the end of the final partition that had been placed on the ground. Though this time, Maximus' stomach didn't signal fullness, but was merely content. Upon seeing this, White Lightening gently applied pressure once more to Maximus' middle, and felt a springy, but yielding surface. The already present abundance of fat was steadily stretching over Maximus' belly, creating a cushion of soft, resistant layer similar to a mattress over a bed.

Pushing harder, the obsidian equine was able to gauge the stallion's fullness and knew that there was still plenty of room left. The horse signaled for Fen to lower the next row of pastries, and once all six were placed on the ground, White Lightening began the cycle once again. Though this time he often left a lightly placed hoof on the stallion's growing belly to feel it expand. As Maximus dutifully marched his way through the second round of euphoria, White Lightening's hoof slowly went from sinking into a plush layer of fat to gently wobbling on the equine's belly before finishing at a sturdy, but still well-indented placement on the equine's stomach.

At this point, Maximus' stomach was beginning to spark with small pangs of fullness. The quivering, bulging mass slowly contracted in and out with Maximus' labored pants. The vision was hypnotic, and White Lightening found himself transfixed at the rounded sight before remembering that he still had three rows to go. White Lightening raised his head to signal Fen, but the observant henchman was already removing the next row of pastries.

White Lightening moved on to the next bout of pastries, stimulated by Maximus' impressive growth. The horse himself was slightly dazed from the elated sense of feeling his stomach stretch once more. Being rounded out and filled with the pastries was a satisfying and pleasurable endeavor for the stranded horse. Maximus slowly lifted his head to feast on the next row of confections, and once again he felt the almost familiar pressure of White Lightening's hoof on the middle of his gelatinous belly.

Three partitions into the row of pastries, Maximus began to feel an odd discomfort at the front and back of his belly. As he ventured into the fourth box, the discomfort grew into a nuisance and then it became downright painful. A biting, pinching feeling pulsed from two ends of his belly and Maximus stopped eating to take a moment and inspect the source. He then realized that his belly, with the abundance of food being crammed into it, had slowly pushed against his front and back legs. A V-shaped triangle of pudge bulged from the natural opening in his legs and tapered off where they were bound by the ropes. The pinching feeling came from Maximus' stomach being forced into the crevice created by his legs.

White Lightening who also sensed that something was amiss, as he felt Maximus break the pattern of eating and disrupted the expansion of his belly. Seeing the problem, the black stallion opted to simply have one of his henchmen cut the bonds. Given Maximus' current state, White Lightening was certain that Maximus was more likely to beach himself before he proved a threat.

Once the bonds were slipped, Maximus' belly surged forward and expanded a couple of inches from the restrained pressure. Freeing his sore, plus legs from the ropes provided Maximus with a nice degree of relief. The horse then shifted into a more comfortable position, causing his belly to splay itself on the floor.

With a renewed vigor, Maximus polished off the rest of the row of pastries in quick fashion before looking to White Lightening almost expectedly. Nodding, White Lightening had Fen place the next row of pastries before the bloated horse. Four more partitions disappeared before Maximus' stomach elicited a protesting gurgle to signify that it was overfull. Maximus noted this, but forged on; almost eager to see how far he could get. By the end of the row, Maximus' belly was taught, with a strained layer of fat covering it. There was a slight feeling of resistance, but that was it.

Moving onto the final row, Maximus chowed down, but with less vigor. White Lightening stood fascinated as the horse sluggishly plowed through the remaining pastries. His stomach stretching alarmingly. By the final partition, Maximus' belly was drum tight, and had no resistance at all. The equine's bulging gut groaned and creaked from the pressure, and pushed against Maximus' legs. Laying on his side, the belly rose a good two feet above him and hung level with his knees. Maximus was hit hard with the fullness and drifted to sleep.

All he heard was a knock at the door. Who was it?
155111222112222111.title: White Lightening Feeds Maximus the pastries unt...

choices: White Lightening saves the prince and shopkeeper by springing into action
He Whinnies to convince the Captain of another way, but the Captain is uncertain
1551112221122221111.content:
As the stuffed-to-the-brim Maximus drifted off into a food coma, Fen quickly walked over to the shop's entrance and let in the unknown guest. Flynn heard the knock too, and lifted his head slowly to see who was at the door. At first the figure was silhouetted against the early-morning light pouring into the shop, but once Fen closed the door, Flynn saw that it was the Captain of the Guard. The prince couldn't help expressing his surprise at seeing such an authoritative figure strolling into the scene. The Captain as a tall, lithe man with a dark, angular mustache and piercing green eyes. 'To think that this was the man that had hunted Flynn for so long, only to turn out to be an enemy of the kingdom instead.' Flynn could appreciate the irony.

"Well," the Captain said, with an mischievous smirk, "Looks like White Lightening here was a little eager to wait for me." He glanced over at the dark stallion who was still resting a gentle hoof on Maximus' taught, bulging side. He seemed transfixed by the sheer size and volume of Maximus' belly, noting the stretched tender skin poking out beneath the thin fur of the stranded horse's bloated belly. With each breath Maximus' stomach groaned quietly from the enormous pressure in his gut and occasionally shivered in discomfort from the fullness, but otherwise Maximus was entirely out of it.

"White Lightening," the Captain addressed the horse in a firm, direct manner to get the horse's attention. "Has everything gone according to plan?" The ebony horse nodded in affirmation, and gently lifted his hoof off Maximus' quivering mass.

"I don't understand!" Flynn cut in, unable to contain himself any longer. "Why would you, one of the integral parts of the kingdom's security, side with a horse whose blatantly endangering others?"

The Captain turned toward the prince, and sighed. He realized that Flynn deserved some explanation, especially after the fact that his wife had almost been killed in one of their "incidents." The man sat down at one of the booths across from Flynn, and rested his hands in front of him, like a parent confronting their child with an ugly truth.

"It's very simple actually," the Captain said. "Maximus is..well....a very special horse. I think we can all attest to that fact." Flynn nodded, and was surprised to see the captors and even White Lightening nodding in agreement. "After all," he continued, "Maximus was an elite member of the kingdom who risked his life and reputation to aid you in the rescuing of the princess." Flynn understood the notion and kept silent for the Captain to continue.

"Well after he aided in her rescue, Maximus rose to an entirely different plane of heroism." The Captain gestured to Flynn, "And you were elevated right along side him. You were both legends by the time you married Rapunzel, with a reputation that spread throughout the kingdom." The Captain had a far away look in his eyes, Flynn knew that the Captain had entered the realm of memory, and decided to let the Captain continue undisturbed.

"At first I was exceptionally proud of my steed. He was an incredible horse with an incredible gift for justice. When the King promoted him to Commander, I could barely contain myself with the pride and joy I felt for him. Maximus proved to be a natural leader and commander too; devising training programs, fitness regiments, strategic practices, placing the Kingdom's well-being far before his own. He was more than my horse by this point, he was a figure of authority and strength for everyone. The soldiers idolized him, and Maximus continued to expand his influence over the Kingdom with exceptional results. But that wasn't the only thing that expanded. I'm sure you recall Maximus' ..er....acquisition of considerable weight over the last few months. Well as Maximus increased his role in the Kingdom's safety, his fitness levels plummeted.'

'At first Maximus was only slightly overweight. I worked with him quite often, so I was aware of the changes; yet they weren't bothersome to anyone, so I kept quite. After a couple of months though, Maximus truly started to stand apart from the other horses. His harness began straining against his belly, his rear jiggled more and more, his face developed additional adipose. Maximus steadily increased his waistline, and it eventually became impossible for me or anyone else to ignore. Recruits and seasoned soldiers alike began to mock him, smiling whenever Maximus entered or left a room, laughing as his belly swayed from the slightest movement. Rather than take his instructions seriously, they would imitate his mannerisms behind his back. This resulted in a noticeable drop of discipline of the troops...and it was then that I realized something must be done.'

'So one night, after Maximus left a briefing, almost being lodged in the door from his bulging sides, I quietly slipped out of the kingdom and went back to my home village. I'll admit that from the start, I was looking for another horse to replace Maximus. Establishing a man in his post would be impossible, seeing as a non-sentient creature can garner much more respect from their efforts than an ordinary man. I made my way back to my home, and perused the farms around the village to see if another could fulfill the task. This was when I came across White Lightening. Everything about him was perfect, where Maximus had a bulbous, low-hanging belly, White Lightening possessed a trim, toned figure. Rather than a large, swaying backside, White Lightening was perfectly fit. White Lightening could run a hundred yards without being winded and sloshing around like a water balloon. And then there was his trademark bolt on his flank. The perfect symbol to become an emblem of a new hero in the kingdom.'

'So we planned out a series of meticulously orchestrated accidents, where Maximus would happen to be at the time, but White Lightening would be just around the corner to one-up him. It was a double edged plan, impressing the citizens with a new hero while simultaneously deflating a certain obese equine's ego further and further. Of course we had help from a couple of friends," the Captain nodded to the captors standing patiently around the shop, "their knowledge of the city and planning the accidents was instrumental in the ploy. But," The Captain suddenly reached forward, and laid a fatherly hand on Flynn's. "We only meant to discredit Maximus, no one else." Flynn grimaced at the sentiment, and was begrudgingly ready to accept that there was some logic to the Captain's motives when he remembered one integral thing.

"You almost killed my wife, the princess of the kingdom. One of the very members you were sworn to protect." Flynn growled angrily. "He may have let himself go," Flynn motioned at the bloated horse, "But Maximus would never put an innocent in harm's way simply because it might elevate another figure." The Captain was taken aback by Flynn's vehemence, before a sad, but sinister smile crept across his face.

"I had hoped you would see the reasoning behind my cause," he said, slowly shaking his head. "That this," the Caption slapped Maximus's stuffed belly, eliciting a startled whinny from the dozing horse who woke with a jolt. "Is more dangerous to the kingdom than losing a couple of citizens in a campaign for a new hero."

Maximus stared at his old friend and mentor with a wide eyes that held a fearful and confused gaze. Not quite comprehending the caliber of the situation, Maximus glanced around the room. Going from the Captain to Flynn then to White Lightening, and back to the Captain.

"But now," the Captain sighed shaking his head, "we are at a crossroads. We can't have a powerful figure such as yourself going back to the King with word of my efforts, so I suppose there's nothing I can really do, but kill you and the shop keeper."

The Captain gestured at the captors to move onto the bound Flynn and Tristan, two of them withdrew daggers.

Maximus whinnied with fear and desperation. He glanced pleadingly at White Lightening, seeming to exchange a frenetic conversation with the obsidian horse. White Lightening was also extremely concerned, he had been recruited to feign accidents and become a hero. Not stand idly by while two innocent people were executed in cold
blood.

White Lightening frantically glanced around the room before jumping making a decision.

What was it?
1551112221122221111.title: The Captain of the Guard who was in alliance wi...

choices: To the outskirts of the kingdom to get aid from an old friend of Tristan's
To the Castle to get help from the royal family
15511122211222211111.content:
White Lightening stood rigidly, as he ran different scenarios through his head before realizing that he couldn’t let the Captain kill the two captives. His sense of justice, and a quick glance at Maximus’ straining belly cemented his decision to protect the bound victims.

Finalizing the decision, White Lightening leapt into action. Taking into account the obsidian horse’s speed, agility, desperation, element of surprise, and the fact that he had spent months of training to “save” others, White Lightening was able to get a good edge in the fight.

Flynn and Tristan, both possessing the same enhanced perception of their surroundings due to their fear of being killed, read the horse’s intentions like a book. As the horse readied themselves, the prince and shopkeeper did so in turn. Both men tensed their legs, hunched forward slightly, and as White Lightening leapt toward the Captain, they took advantage of their captor hovering knives.

In beautiful, synchronous motions, White Lightening butted the Captain hard enough to plow straight into an unsuspecting Fen. Both men dropped like sacks of potatoes. Collapsing to the ground with winded expressions. Flynn and Tristan simultaneously propelled their bodies and heads backwards and up. Smashing their heads into the base of their captors’ chins, snapping the captors’ necks backwards and knocking them out cold. As each captor lost consciousness, their grip on the knives slipped. Tristan and Flynn grabbed them, slit their hand ties, and then leaned forward to do the same to their feet.

White Lightening meanwhile, dealt with the Captain and Fen. Both quickly recovered from the sudden blow, and grappled over each other to stand. White Lightening managed to bring a cloven hoof down on Fen’s head, knocking him out for good. The Captain struggled to stand unsteadily, still wheezing but recovered. He brandished his own dagger, grimacing at the horse with a light of betrayal flashing in his eyes. White Lightening pawed the ground nervously, prancing from hoof to hoof to keep the Captain guessing.

Unknown to the stygian stallion, the third captor was quietly approaching the horse from behind. As he crept up behind the lightening-marked horse with a drawn and raised dagger, the Captain’s gaze flickered slightly from the horse to the approaching captor. Sensing danger, White Lightening turned in time to hear a loud FWOMP and a large white blur, before the captor was sent flying across the shop and sent tumbling over a table.

Maximus stood, stooped over, his belly rocking and wobbling from the sudden impact. Every inch of the equine’s body quivered from the effort, from the horse’s flabby, creased neck to his bulging, swaying belly back to his two bulbous butt cheeks smushing together. The horse’s spine formed a concave ark as it dipped under the incredible weight of the lard-laden sack jiggling underneath it.

The horse had to adopt a wider stance as his belly bulged against his legs and demanded more room to occupy. The quick movements had rendered the horse breathless and shaken.

The Captain was almost speechless from the horse’s rapid movements, and the momentary lapse in belief was all White Lightening needed to place a well-aimed kick between the Captain’s green eyes. The Captain crumpled to the floor, and White Lightening whinnied in satisfaction that the attackers were indisposed. The black horse trotted forward and gently nuzzled the Maximus’ belly to snap the bloated equine out of his adrenaline-fueled state.

Turning his fat face to White Lightening, Maximus’ neck formed abundant accordion love handles as he nodded in recognition and appreciation for the other horse’s actions.

Flynn and Tristan had both managed to free themselves from their bonds, and watched the entire ordeal with unbridled fascination. Seeing such a large, heavy figure move with unearthly speed was impressive enough. But when said figure plowed into a captor with a wrecking ball for a gut, they might as well have been dreaming.

Tristan was the first to overcome his shock. The shopkeeper took command, and instructed Flynn to help him tie up the criminals before they awakened. “How do you know how to do all this,” Flynn blurted out, as the thought became a vocal entity.

Tristan grinned slyly, “Just because I’m a shopkeeper, doesn’t mean I was always one,” the greying man explained, “I used to be a soldier, and a damn good one at that. I’ll explain later, but for now we need to truss these fellows and get the hell out of here.”

“Why?” Flynn said, “Wouldn’t it be easier to fetch some guards?”

“The Captain might have allies under his thumb, and I have a bad feeling that Fen has some friends who are paid to back him up in these areas.”

Satisfied, Flynn expertly tied the men up, while White Lightening consoled the shell-shocked Maximus. “And thank you White Lightening,” Flynn said to the horse. “You saved our lives, and took the right path. Would you consider coming with us?”

White Lightening considered the offer, then looked at the bound men, before resting his eyes on Maximus’ bulging middle. The stallion’s rounded sides rhythmically swelled with each breath, wobbling slightly from the movement. Maximus nodded to White Lightening, affirming his support for the offer as well.

White Lightening turned to the prince and nodded. The four individuals quickly left the shop, though Maximus was slightly wedged in the doorway, and needed help to squish his heft all the way through.

After they traveled down the cobbled street, towards what? To receive help from whom?
15511122211222211111.title: White Lightening saves the prince and shopkeepe...

choices: The group arrive at the farm and meet Warren
They are intercepted by some of the Captain’s men, who has named them traitors
155111222112222111111.content:
The odd group moved as quickly as they could through the Kingdom’s streets. Taking advantage of the early morning hour, the sun was only cresting the horizon.

Tristan explained to the others that he still knew some old friends from before his days as a soldier, and opted to seek one of them out in order to regroup and get help. They moved at a slower than normal pace due to the incredible amount of weight wobbling beneath Maximus’ back.

The white stallion was forced to adopt a slightly widened stance, as his bulging sides and flanks blipped out against his legs. The horse’s belly was a sight in itself, as it hung low and heavy; almost even with Maximus knees which kept brushing and indenting the soft flesh with each step he took. All the food he had consumed had finally begun to be digested, and the horse’s stomach went from a drum-taught sphere to a softer, yielding ellipse that jumped like a salmon.

White Lightening walked behind Maximus to ensure that there was no one following them and be of quick assistance to the obese equine. Although his view of the horse’s jiggling posterior was an added bonus. Each bulbous cheek was the size of a melon, and often created a flabby crevice for the unfortunate tail entrenched between them. Their rounded appearance was nicely complemented by Maximus’ belly which bulged well out to each side of him. Occasionally it unintentionally brushed a stray store display or wall, and was momentarily smushed against the sides.

Maximus seemed to become increasingly use to the weight as they navigated their way beyond the Kingdom’s borders and into the surrounding farmland. The sun was high above them by the time the group reached the countryside and they decided to take a well-deserved break in a small clearing hidden from the view of the main road.

Once they came to a stop, Maximus gratefully sank forward on his forelocks, before trying to collapse his back legs. When he did so, something felt slightly off. As he looked down, he realized his gargantuan belly was so large, that it pressed into the soft grass and actually raised the horse slightly off the ground. Love handles suddenly appeared and creased as Maximus’ belly pooled out across the grass.

Flynn and Tristan found the event slightly comedic, while White Lightening was transfixed on the horse’s precarious position atop his monolithic stomach. Eventually, Maximus opted to lay down to one side, and allowed for his belly to rise formidably above his head. Forming a small mound of soft, supple horse flesh. Once he was comfortable, Tristan cleared his throat and began to explain the friend he had in mind.

“He is a trustworthy man of notable disposition and has saved my life countless times.” Tristan testified the man’s reputation with such voracity that the others had almost no trouble believing it to be true.

“What’s his name?” Flynn asked.

“Warren,” Tristan answered, “He was a my training partner in the army, before we became soldiers. He was always the level-headed one who tried to rationalize a situation before taking action. Often stopped me from getting my arse kicked when I took offense to a slur or challenge. We had strengths that complemented each other and made us a great pair.”

“So why did you guys quit?” Flynn inquired curiously. The horses were also focused on Tristan with singular intent.

“Well,” Tristan chuckled, “We both began to grow weary of the risks taken by soldiers. When you have an inseparable friend at you side, and are constantly thrown into life-threatening situations, you always begin to look for a way out.” Tristan sighed and leaned back. “The final straw was when that lovely girl, Rapunzel, was taken. The insipid wench that kidnapped her was old, but cunning and devious. When she slipped into the castle, she didn’t go unopposed. Warren spotted her and tried to intervene, but the old witch possessed a dagger/ She sliced it across Warren’s face and took his left eye. She would have finished the job if I hadn’t spotted her and called out. I was the one who sounded the alarm the night the princess disappeared.’

‘So I suppose you” he gestured towards Flynn, “Can see why I have quite a bit of respect for you two. Dispelling the old cur was a moment of closure for my friend and I. And as for why we left? Well, Warren was simply unable to perform his duties any longer, and I wasn’t letting him go anywhere without me. He moved to a farm in the country, secluded from others while I stayed back to pursue a career in confections.” He chuckled as he glanced over at Maximus’ enormous belly, which swelled and retracted steadily with each breath, sweeping away blades of grass as the soft flesh slid over the ground.

“There is a certain irony when what perhaps would have been my greatest customer, brought with him an incredible vice of criminals.” Maximus adopted an apologetic expression on his cushioned face, but only managed to look like an adorably plush stuffed animal one might see in a children’s toy chest. Tristan laughed out loud now, and waved away the horse’s attempt at an apology. “Don’t worry, you could’t have known. Besides, a little turmoil always keeps one’s mind and body fresh. I enjoyed the change of pace.” He said. Tristan stood up and brushed stray grass from his pants. “So now, I suppose we continue on to my good friend’s farm and develop the next part of our plan.”

The others followed Tristan’s example, but Maximus had quite a bit of trouble. His big, blubbery belly was a formidable obstacle that seemed quite content with staying at rest on the grass. Maximus strained to push himself up, but only managed to push himself further into his own belly. His efforts caused his gut to fold over on itself, and jiggled like jelly. Suddenly the huge stallion felt a large push from under his back, and realized that White Lightening had nosed himself under Maximus and was using his strength to aid the white stallion.

Maximus tried again and felt himself begin to lift, while White Lightening helped him. The obsidian stallion’s muzzle was buried in a large expanse of supple horse flesh. The belly almost engulfed his entire face, and caused the surrounding adipose to bulge outwards from the displacement. White Lightening pressed harder, burying his chest and forelegs into Maximus' plush belly to gain more traction. It felt like trying to move a sack of pudding. Maximus struggled to keep his feet under him, but had a hard time with his bulbous stomach obscuring them from view. The process was precarious, but the two horses eventually made progress against the imposing belly.

Maximus finally came onto all for legs once again, his belly rocking from the change in stance. His entire body wobbled like jello, and his swaying stomach almost threw him off balance as it formed a counterweight to the rest of Maximus body.

Once he was stable, Tristan lead the group back to the road and they continued their trek down the pathway.

“How far is it?” Flynn inquired.

“About a day’s walk at our pace,” Tristan replied.

Together the retired soldier, the prince, the heroic black stallion, and the bulbous, bulging equine made their way down the road into an uncertain future.

And that future was?
155111222112222111111.title: To the outskirts of the kingdom to get aid from...

choices: The three men plan more and White Lightening and Maximus explore the farm
They are set upon by bandits in the middle of the night and Maximus is captured
1551112221122221111111.content:
Flynn and Tristan traveled slightly out in front of the horses to anticipate any unexpected travelers who might recognize the faces of the prince, White Lightening, and Maximus. Though the latter was probably safe due to his large, wobbling stature.

White Lightening walked a couple of yards behind Maximus to ensure that no one tried to sneak up on the group from behind. The placement afforded White Lightening with the increasingly familiar sight of Maximus' bulging sides framing his wide-spread butt. Both of which wobbled with each step the burdened stallion took.

Eventually they reached the farm of Tristan's friend, Warren. As they drew closer, Maximus began to truly feel weighed down. He'd been forced to walk with a slightly widened gait, due to the imposing presence of his belly. His low hanging gut continuously swayed from side to side and forced Maximus to concentrate on keeping his balance. Hours of doing just this had reduced the poor equine to a gasping, heaving wreck. By the time they were making their way down the final pathway to Warren's farm, Maximus was stumbling from slight deliriousness and fatigue. More than anything, the obese equine desired water.

Ad they finally spotted the farmhouse, Maximus' eyes were only focused on the sight of a water filled barrel propped against the side of it. He trotted as fast as his lard-laden legs could carry him, stuck his head in the barrel, and began sucking down water. While Maximus occupied himself with quenching his thirst, Tristan greeted his old friend who was making his way towards them from his quaint cottage.

"Hello old friend," Tristan greeted the man, before embracing him with a big bear hug and a hearty slap on the back. "It's been quite a while." Tristan released his grip and the two turned towards the others as Tristan made to introduce his life long friend to them.

Warren was a sturdy, well-built man who stood a couple inches shorter than Tristan and Flynn. He had close-cropped brown hair, a slightly crooked nose, and his right eye shone with unabashed humor. Flynn couldn't help but have his gaze drawn to the man's left eye, which was scarred vertically from the middle of his cheek to the top of his forehead. The eyelid was slightly ridged in the middle, and covered an empty socket.

"Well go one then my good man! Don't be shy." Warren boomed in a deep, throaty voice. "I prefer people to look me directly in the eye rather than try to be all polite and pretend to avoid it." Flynn was momentarily shocked by his directness, but quickly recovered and walked forward to shake the man's hand.

"I'm Flynn Rider," the prince said simply, "It's a pleasure to meet you."

Warren smiled and said, "Yes I've heard all about you! You saved the princess and became a national hero. I applaud you for your services to the kingdom." Flynn nodded in thanks for the complement and returned the recognition by saying, "And Tristan has told me all about your days as a loyal soldier and guard for the royal family. I admire your loyalty and brevity." Warren chuckled and slapped the prince on the back. "Thank you son."

Tristan then introduced White Lightening, who Warren only seemed to judge for his intentions above anything else. Despite the stygian horse's initial efforts to dethrone Maximus, White Lightening had proven himself to be a trustworthy ally. The two exchanged nods of recognition and Warren moved on.

"And then there's Maximus..." Tristan began, before trailing off when he realized where the horse was.

As Maximus was brought to Warren's attention, the supple, barrel-shaped horse had finished nearly the entire barrel of water and proceeded to collapse joyously against the side of the barn in a refreshing patch of shade. The miles of walking Maximus had done were enough to burn off a couple of calories from his bloated stature and his stomach had initially shrunk slightly. But now it was bulging firmly once more, rocking and sloshing from the gallons of water it contained. Maximus lay in an undignified manner, with his belly bulging out and above him, his tongue lolled out, and creases of fat forming as his belly began to fold over itself.

The water had expanded the horse's belly considerably, and now Warren walked over with a sly chuckle and said, "This must be Maximus, the horse with a larger than life reputation and actually appears to truly be larger in life." He placed a hand on the horse's swollen abdomen, which groaned slightly from the touch. It's peak nearly level with Warren's chest, the horse neighed a weak greeting to the new face. He attempted to look up at the single-eyed soldier, but only succeeded in making his neck compress in a series of love handles and add further ripples to his water-balloon of a belly. It was all White Lightening could do not to press his muzzle into the soft belly.

Maximus slowly drifted off to sleep once he knew that he had at least managed to be introduced to the new individual. Once he was out of it, Warren turned toward the others, "Has a hardy appetite does he?" Flynn, Tristan, and White Lightening nodded in assent. They had all witnessed the eating capabilities of the beached stallion, and were entirely convinced that Maximus could swallow a hay bale whole if he wished.

"Well when he wakes up, he'll be in for a surprise." Warren chuckled inwardly. "I have one of the largest apple farms in the area, and this one would certainly appreciate some fresh produce." He gestured to the gently rising and falling belly which swelled and gurgled with each breath the horse took.

"So now, I suppose we should get serious," Warren said, "I'm guessing you didn't come here with some of the Kingdom's most influential figures simply for a surprise visit." He directed the statement at Tristan, who grimaced and said, "We have a little trouble with the Captain of the Guard."

Warren invited them to come join him in his home for some fresh water and food so that they could get the story in full. While Flynn and Tristan went with him, White Lightening stayed behind. Being a non-sentient creature he wouldn't much use in explaining the details to Warren.

As the trio disappeared into the cottage, White Lightening took the time to fully appreciate Maximus's incredible size and girth. The dozing equine's neck was swaddled in rolls of fat that bunched up and provided Maximus with a couple of extra chins. The horse's upper leg was risen in the air and rested on Maximus's lopsided belly which took the form of a slightly miss-shappen half circle. The top half bulged proudly and dipped down on itself slightly from the weight of sloshing liquid inside it. The bottom half was pressed against the grass where it formed luscious love handles that rippled in any movement. His posterior featured two overblown cheeks quashed together from their own weight and bulged outwards on their own.

White Lightening padded forward, and slowly laid down before resting his head against Maximus' supple midsection. It was the softest pillow White Lightening would ever encounter. His head waved slightly from the displacement he caused by squishing a part of the belly. Soon he fell into a blissful sleep of his own, because after all, heroic horses needed their rest too.

As the two horses dozed, and the three men went over the recent events and began to plan, the afternoon light faded into darkness and night fell.

What was to come the next day?
1551112221122221111111.title: The group arrive at the farm and meet Warren

choices: The horses wake the next morning to be greeted by the men who have a plan
Maximus and White Lightening are captured in the night
15511122211222211111111.content:
As Flynn, Tristan, and Warren resided in the cabin to go over a plan for taking the corrupt Captain of the Guard down from his position, White Lightening dozed against the huge, round belly of an unconscious Maximus. The two stayed this way for several hours, before Maximus finally began to stir. The estranged horse slowly woke up, and for the first time in three days was able to take the time to register his situation.

Arching his neck, Maximus noted how rolls of fat bunched along his neck and his cheeks poofed to either side of his face. He lifted his head further and drew in an impressed breath which caused his belly to swell slightly. All he could see was a bulbous white dome bulging proudly and protruding almost three feet out. The massive organ sloshed gently from the little water it still contained, and with this movement, Maximus noticed a soft pressure on the lower half of his belly. He couldn't quite identify it, until it began shifting and the obsidian head of White Lightening peeked curiously over its equator. Snorting in greeting, the black stallion rose to his feet and padded over to Maximus' front to give him a better position for communicating.

Looking up at the stygian stallion, Maximus nickered softly to express his thanks for White Lightening's help in their daring escape. The heroic horse snorted in return, before gesturing vehemently behind him to the rows of apple trees in the orchard beyond. White Lightening's intent was obvious, as Maximus craned his head to full extent and realized that his absolute favorite fruit resided with the rows of trees. His mouth began watering at the prospect of consuming more of them, and why not? Maximus reasoned that if he was already such an incredibly large size, then consumption of something so healthy as an apple would surely be beneficial to the bloated equine.

Maximus nodded in agreement that he would love to go down to the orchard, and White Lightening quickly, almost eagerly, moved forward to help the white stallion to his feet. The two of them opted for the same method they'd utilized earlier and White Lightening bent his neck to use his head as a wedge/lift for Maximus. Slowly, but surely Maximus rose with the aid of the barn, his stomach squished against its side wile White Lightening pushed from the other. The two opposing forces cause Maximus' belly to bulge extensively from the displacement.

As Maximus finally got all four legs underneath him, he realized his mistake a split second too late. Having slept for several hours, the horse's pudgy legs had fallen asleep and were temporarily dead from the inactivity. Maximus attempted to lean back against the wall, but he was leaning too heavily on White Lightening and ended up collapsing sideways on the unfortunate equine.

Maximus' legs gave out, and his stomach slowly tilted to his left side before Maximus toppled, belly first, onto White Lightening. The heroic horse only had time to let out a startled whinny before his head and back were smushed by the monolithic belly. Luckily for White Lightening, Maximus' stomach was considerably cushioned from layers of fat and the left over water the horse had consumed. He felt as if a giant, jello-filled balloon was encasing his entire body in a soft fuzzy cocoon. The air was knocked out of White Lightening's lung as the majority of the obese horse's weight came to a jiggling halt on his shoulders and back. Maximus was effectively stranded, as his legs stuck out in four directions, and his stomach was pressed in by White Lightening's body. His belly bulged with random love handles that rippled with tremors and quivered where they met White Lightening's torso.

Gasping from the incident, both Maximus and White Lightening let loose anxious braying laughs as they began to see the humor in their situation. After eventually calming down, White Lightening indicated a rolling gesture with his head that meant he planned to lever Maximus off him by slowly rotating the horse off his back. Maximus nodded, and the black stallion slowly braced his legs before lifting himself slightly to provide a crude ramp. Maximus slowly rolled over, his belly sloshing madly from the constant changes in direction until the horse was unceremoniously dumped onto the ground where he rested on his bulging belly. White Lightening shook his head to cool himself, before going over and helping the fattened horse stand.

For a moment they simply grinned at one another, before Maximus snorted and indicated toward the apple orchard intently. White Lightening nodded vigorously, and the two began to trek their way into the neat sentries of apple trees. A late afternoon sun cast deeply etched shadows into the pathways, which provided a welcomed relief from the blistering sun.

Maximus was utterly captivated by the pervasion and size of the apples growing throughout the plantation. Luscious orbs in various hues of reds, greens, and yellows hung from the branches of sturdy trees that dipped under their weight in a similar fashion to Maximus' belly in proximity to his spine.

Tongue lolling out, Maximus continued for about a quarter mile before happening upon a basket of scarlet reds that seemed to have only recently been picked. Looking back at White Lightening, as if to seemingly ask for permission to indulge himself, he received a rigorous nod from the black stallion.

While Maximus unorthodoxly consumed the basket of apples, White Lightening contented himself by nibbling on a couple of strays that had fallen from the nearby trees. He also cast periodic glances at the busy equine's bulbous posterior, which jiggled from the ferocity with which Maximus attacked the apples. Each cheek wobbled and gently slapped against each other.

Soon Maximus finished the basket and burped contentedly. He turned to White Lightening who raised his eyebrows questioningly, as if to say 'Is that all?'

Maximus snorted and looked up to the trees hungrily, salivating at the thought of more apples. Following his gaze, White Lightening suddenly had an idea. He athletically leapt into the air, and jarred one of the tree's branches. Several apples tumbled to the ground, which Maximus surged forward to eat, only to be stopped short by White Lightening who gestured for the obese equine to lie down. Taking heed of the request, Maximus laid down on one bulbous side, and curiously gazed at the the black stallion.

White Lightening then picked an apple up with his teeth and walked over to the bloated horse and proffered the apple to Maximus. The plan clicked in Maximus' head as he realized the stygian horse's intentions and thought back to the night before in the pastry shop. This time though, White Lightening took his time to feed each apple to the fattened stallion. Noting that with each bite Maximus took, his belly swelled a fraction of an inch more.

Over a period of two hours, White Lightening fed Maximus close to a hundred of the apples. Combined with the thirty or so present in the basket, it wasn't long before Maximus' belly once again reached a creaking point of fullness. His taught tummy gurgle and protested from the incredible volume of food stuffed into it. Each movement from Maximus elicited a loud groan that testified the equine's exceptionally bloated capacity. White Lightening, satisfied with Maximus' appetite noted that the sun was finally setting, and casting fading slices of light overhead. He realized that Maximus wasn't going anywhere in his condition, and decided that this was as good as any place to spend the night.

Collapsing his legs, White Lightening made to rest his head against his friend's tight stomach, but was greeted with a hard, lumpy, and inconsistent surface. He realized the apples weren't entirely digested, so Maximus appeared to have consumed a large, uneven rock that stretched his gut to rigid proportions.

Sighing, White Lightening contented himself by resting his head on the equine's supple neck, which contracted rhythmically with Maximus' breaths. Closing his eyes, White Lightening drifted into sleep and into the night where the unknown waited.

What was it?
15511122211222211111111.title: The three men plan more and White Lightening an...

choices: Maximus trained and lost a little weight with White Lightening's help
They were cut short by a haven of bandits
155111222112222111111111.content:
The next morning, Maximus was awoken by the constant chirping of birds and a strange pressure on his neck. Yawning expansively, the obese horse slowly blinked the sleep out of his eyes in order to regain a better sense of his mental faculties. Noticing that the effort to awake himself via inhaling fresh air wasn't alleviating the pressure on his neck, Maximus finally turned his fattened head towards the source.

White Lightening lay with his head draped in the plush rolls of the stallion's neck and was blissfully unconscious. Maximus realized that the black equine must have been severely lacking in sleep from the events that had transpired over the course of the previous couple days. Attempting to shift his head back into a more suitable position, White Lightening rolled over and ended up with his face buried in the Maximus' flabby shoulder. Suddenly finding himself unable to breath due to the suffocating layer of fat that encircled his face, White Lightening bolted awake in a flash.

Inhaling deeply, the athletically built stallion quickly gathered his surroundings before laying eyes on a widely smiling Maximus. The horse let loosed a gentle bray that transcribed to the equine equivalent of a laugh. The sound was considerably deeper as it reverberated off the horse's cavernous belly. White Lightening snorted in turn and rolled his eyes before clambering to his feet to stretch. In doing so, he was also afforded a good view of just how large Maximus had truly grown over the last couple days.

Maximus' face was swaddled in adipose and currently puffed around and under his muzzle to form an extra set of chins. The equine's neck was riddled with rolls of fat that creased from the slightest movement. The most impressive aspect of Maximus' overblown stature was his belly, which had digested the majority of the apples into an addition several inches of plush fat. The horse's belly seemed to bulge in every direction and, with Maximus laying on his side, was almost level with White Lightening's own trim stomach standing up. The sheer weight of the colossal gut caused it to fold over slightly on itself and form large love handles where it compressed against Maximus' legs in addition to pooling on the ground. His belly possessed a layer of lard almost two feet deep, which was softer and more supple than any mattress one would ever be able to find. Maximus' gelatinous rump also sported to smaller, globular versions of his belly, which rippled from any movement and completely buried the unfortunate tail residing between them.

Maximus was, for all intents and purposes, able to officially stomach another horse if he so desired. As White Lightening helped the bulbous stallion to his feet, Maximus' belly swayed like a water filled hammock and reached slightly past the equine's knees. The two slowly made their way back to Warren's cottage where the man himself sat with Flynn and Tristan who were laughing and talking over a hearty breakfast.

"Well it seems that a certain horse has discovered my legendary apples," Warren boomed as he was the bulging stallion waddle their way at a slow pace. From his vantage point, Warren could see the equine's sides swollen well beyond his shoulders and wobbling from side to side.

The good humored farmer laughed loudly at the sight, before saying, "I'm glad someone enjoyed them."

Maximus' ears swiveled toward the sudden sound and a guilty grin slowly crept across his pudgy muzzle as he made his way over to them. Once they arrived, Maximus settled down on his belly and was pleased to discover that he was actually quite comfortable resting on it as if it were a jello-filled bean bag. Settling down, the horse unintentionally squished his stomach out to the sides, causing them to bulge further until it supported him. Smirking satisfactorily, Maximus looked over at White Lightening whose gaze lingered on the incredible sight before snapping out of it and looking back to the three grinning men. Both horses nodded for them to continue on, indicating their desire to hear the plan.

"So," Tristan began, taking the lead in describing the plan as he was the most adept at explaining, "We all have several advantages on our side going into this. We each," he gestured to the separate individuals in turns, "Have plenty of experience and familiarity with the layout of the kingdom. We have the power of compelling and well-respected members of the public. With Flynn and Maximus being legends and White Lightening becoming a hero. Warren and I are also well connected to some friends who live in town. We also have the advantage of White Lightening still appearing to be under the Captain of the Guard's influence, which would enable him to discredit the Captain just as effectively as the Captain's intent to discredit Maximus."

Everyone nodded at this and agreed that everything said so far was true.

"Our plan then," Tristan said, "Is to turn the Captain's most influential weapon against him. White Lightening is the spearhead of the Captain's campaign to shift Maximus out of his position, and staging an accident is his method of doing so. Now we have gone over the possibility of having Maximus save someone else in a staged accident, but we realized that this would only pit the two horses against each other, and that wouldn't work. So we realized that we needed to have the Captain become personally involved, perhaps seeming to endanger Flynn in some way, and then have Maximus and White Lightening work together to rescue him. The public loves duos, and a pair of horses intent on saving the kingdom is the perfect way to unite their voice to us and to expel the Captain from anymore plotting. We thought we would have Flynn sneak back into the city, seeing as he's the prince after all and be placed in the position of speaking out against the Captain's actions. When the Captain approached Flynn, he would then challenge the Captain to defend himself. When the Captain is asked to produce his supporting figure head: White Lightening, both Maximus and White Lightening come into protest against him."

Taking a deep breath, Tristan sat back from his lengthy explanation and looked around. "Any questions?" When no one raised their hands, he said, "Good. It will take a couple of days for us to contact our allies in the kingdom. They'll be able to sneak Maximus and White Lightening in, and then aid in ensuring the Captain is the one confronting the prince." Tristan sighed, "Maximus, this is the harder part for me to ask of you. I'm going to need you to lose a bit of weight. Not all of it, but enough to allow you to walk and trot without the threat of tripping over your own belly."

Maximus considered the request, and realized it was the right thing to do before nodding. White Lightening seemed a little saddened by the thought, but then he stepped forward and gestured to himself before Maximus.

"I'm guessing you're requesting to help him," Tristan asked.

White Lightening nodded and Tristan agreed that this would be beneficial. "Don't worry Maximus," he reassured the bulbous stallion, "It will only be a couple of days, and then you are welcome to the contents of my shop free of charge when this is all finished."

A large smile split Maximus' muzzle at the thought and the horse agreed to go through with the process.

"Now then," Tristan cracked his knuckles, "Let's get to work."

What would happen over the next few days?
155111222112222111111111.title: The horses wake the next morning to be greeted ...

choices: They travel into the Kingdom and are holed up in a hide out
One of the contacts is a traitor and things go awry
1551112221122221111111111.content:
Over the next couple days neither White Lightening nor Maximus relished in the desire to see Maximus' bulging, quivering belly have to shrink. But each horse's sense of cut and loyalty to eradicating the danger presented by the Captain strongly overrode their obsession with Maximus' plush middle. White Lightening monitored the bloated horse's progress, keeping it as simple and painless for both of them as possible. He opted to restrict Maximus' food intake and to take light, but effective walks around the farms with the obese equine.

The two horses devised a small reward system that eased the notion of not bingeing a little: For every half-mile Maximus walked, he was awarded an apple to stave off the worst of his hunger. Every three miles they walked was followed by a short break and a couple more apples. At first, Maximus grew winded simply from traveling a hundred yards, his gasping caused his monolithic belly to sway precariously under his concave spine. He would often simply collapse into the plushness of his belly for comfort, reveling in its softness, as he nuzzled the tender love handles and creases that bulged out from the sides. White Lightening often struggled with the urge to bury his own face in the puffy white layers of lard, but steeled his nerves and grit his teeth whenever the temptation arose.

Through the first day, Maximus' belly only shrank internally. His large, bulging stomach remained as soft and low hanging as ever, but he could feel his appetite decrease effectively, and by the end of the day; Maximus wasn't tempted to simply eat to the point of bursting, but rather to a feeling of contented fullness.

While Maximus and White Lightening worked on the stallion's figure, the prince and two ex-soldiers sent letters out to their trusted allies to plan for the impending procedure of combatting the Captain's influence over the kingdom.

As they gathered their news, they realized that, all in all, the process would take approximately 4 days to complete. This gave White Lightening and Maximus the proper time to work on the overfed stallion's stature and build up his endurance.

On the second day Maximus began to notice his belly decreasing slightly in size. It no longer forced his legs to widen in his stance, and the bulging appendage slowly contracted slightly above the level of the stallion's knees. He was also able to manage quarter-miles at a slow, industrious pace and refrained from simply stuffing himself with the succulent orbs surrounding him. White Lightening also noted the progress, impressed by Maximus' rapid improvement. White Lightening himself also showed additional restrain, but would occasionally and, of course, accidentally stumble head first into Maximus' plush side. He couldn't get over the hypnotic feeling of encasing his muzzle in the deep felt flab, marveling at the abundant warmth and the jello like texture. This happened several times throughout the day, but Maximus never seemed to mind, and often rolled his eyes in amused exasperation at the obsidian stallion's awful attempts to "accidentally" bury his face in Maximus' stomach.

The next day, Maximus had made even more substantial progress. His belly now considerably smaller, though by no means had it lost its pillowy softness, required less and less food. Maximus found he could achieve a trot for short periods of time, and was able to walk half miles with little trouble. His belly was now several inches shy of reaching his knees, and bulged out less when he inhaled, but White Lightening still insisted on aiding the obese stallion to stand up whenever the situation arose for it. Maximus found himself enjoying the contact more and more as he allowed for the stygian horse to aid him each time with a small sense of satisfaction. By the end of the third day, Maximus was about the same size as when he had first entered Tristan's shop. Thinking about the pastries it held, Maximus licked his lips at the prospect of being able to once more stuff himself to bursting capacity. The sentiment stimulated Maximus quite effectively,

The final day before their plan to take the Captain down commenced, Maximus was up to the point where he could walk a mile in relative ease, trot a quarter mile without being winded and his belly was now about half the size it had been when he'd started. It only reached halfway down to his knees, but was still exceedingly soft and supple. White Lightening called off training early for the day, so the two could rest for the ensuing action. Both lounged in the shade of the apple trees and White Lightening laid his head against Maximus' belly. The bulging equine was entirely used to the fact by now, and thought of it as a gesture of endearment. Where the black horse's head lay, Maximus' stomach bulged outwardly, as the weight of the stallion's head displaced some of the horse's plush flab.The two remained in this manner until the sun set and then they made their way over to the cottage where the Flynn, Warren, and Tristan resided.

"So our plan will be implemented in two day's time," Warren said. "We'll be traveling tomorrow and sneak into the kingdom in the night. I have received word that almost a third of the guard is under the Captain's thumb, which means we will have to be careful to only interact with those on our side." Everyone nodded in agreement. "Once we are inside, we will hole up in a friend's house and then in mid-afternoon, when the Captain makes a mandatory round to check on the guards, we will make our move in the Central Square. Flynn will confront the Captain head on, seeing as he is a powerful and well-known figure. He will accuse the Captain of treachery, and when the Captain makes to have Flynn arrested, Maximus and White Lightening will come to the rescue. Tristan and I will be waiting with reinforcements. Hopefully we can draw him out into the light and crush his campaign when White Lightening takes the side against him. Any questions?" Everyone shook their heads. "Alright then, let's get some rest." Warren cracked his knuckles, and everyone took that as the signal for them to get to sleep.

Maximus lay against the barn, White Lightening resting his head on the stallion's belly. They fell asleep as the night fell and a new approached.

What would it bring?
1551112221122221111111111.title: Maximus trained and lost a little weight with W...

choices: The Captain and a group of guards
15511122211222211111111111.content:
The next morning, the sun rose in a beautiful dawn that awoke a sleeping White Lightening with a piercing ray cast straight into his dozing eyes. He slowly sat up and was greeted with a splendid, almost ethereal sight. Maximus' protruding belly aligned almost perfectly with the rising sun, forming an illuminated outline around the stallion's bulging midriff. Hypnotized by the sight, White Lightening quietly laughed to himself at the comparison between the equine's gut and a holy entity. As exceptional as the swollen side was, White Lightening found himself more amused than astounded and simply hoped that the vision was an indication of good luck for their impending trials against the forces of the corrupt Captain.

Stretching, White Lightening noticed the two ex-soldiers and the prince already moving about and readying themselves for the day's walk back to the outskirts of the kingdom. The group would have to be careful on their return trip, as the Captain most likely had guards posted at vital intervals along the main routes into the kingdom, so they would be forced to take back roads, country paths, and short cuts in order for the more famous figures to avoid detection.

Sticking his muzzle once more into the still-dozing Maximus' plush side, White Lightening reveled at the softness of the appendage before feeling a shudder as the voluminous masses' owner snapped awake. Maximus gazed around himself groggily and noted the early hour of the rising sun with an obvious note of disdain. Struggling to his feet, the white stallion trotted over to the rain barrel at the side of the barn and took a refreshing gulp of the cedar-infused liquid. The movement caused his still-large belly to sway steadily and his ample rear end to pad softly together. Taking his fill, Maximus looked around at White Lightening and nodded a friendly greeting. The stygian stallion returned the gesture in kind, before they both headed over to the three men who were talking about the best paths to take.

With Tristan and Warren being retired soldiers, they had been forced to remember the entire surrounding area by heart and mind, and Flynn had grown up navigating the maze of numerous paths in the forests to ironically evade the horse he now considered his best friend. Though in the bulging state Maximus was in, the thief-turned-prince would have had a much easier time escaping presently than when he had to in the past.

The three men seemed to agree that they were relatively safe to move on the main road for about half a day, and would then take an abandoned side road that arced around numerous checkpoints, before dead ending at the barren remnants of a small isolated farm about half a mile from the kingdom's official borders. It was here that they would meet the contacts who would then smuggle the lot of them in two trade wagons, which had been given clearance by the guards not under the Captain's orders to let pass.

Seeing the two horses were also ready, Warren stood up and shouldered his pack. "Looks like we're ready to move out," he said as his one good eye glinted brightly.

Flynn intercepted him and Tristan before they truly got going and said, "Before we leave, I would like to thank you both for your aid and efforts to help us in this situation. I know you didn't have to, but without your ingenuity and connections, we would truly never stand a chance."

Smiling, Warren stepped forward and clapped the prince on the soldier, "My loyalty was cemented to you and that exceptional horse the day you proved yourself a hero and risked your life to save the princess. My duty as a soldier would never allow me to turn my back on brethren, no matter what shape or form they come in." The last part was gently directed at Maximus in a good natured humor, as his shape was mostly round and form mostly bulging.

Tristan nodded at the sentiment, feeling no need to add only but a simply, "We're with you," patting the prince on the back before nodding respectfully to the two horses.

Together, the unified group set out on the road and began their journey back towards the kingdom.

They traveled without incident, before they came across a singular scout while only a mile from the abandoned path. He turned to flee, with the intent of losing his quarry and notifying the main patrol that was a couple miles ahead of him. He never stood a chance. White Lightening lived up to his name, as he ran the soldier down in a flash, tripping him and knocking him out cold with a solid hoof to the head.

The tied him to a nearby tree, out of sight from the main road and left a dagger just out of reach. They knew the soldier would eventually come around, but he would be unable make any noise and would be forced to untie himself over the course of several hours before he managed to be free enough to begin the arduous process of reaching the dagger, and then successfully untying himself. By that time the group would be in the wagons and well past the kingdom's limits.

Once the guard was thoroughly secure, the group continued into the woods in a hurry. They were partially afraid of running into another scout and also racing the descending sun. Maximus maintained a respectable pace, despite his ponderous belly wobbling under him with the consistency of a bowl of jello.

The group made it to the checkpoint just as the sun was lilting in the sky, and Maximus' belly once more accompanied the glowing orb as he gently collapsed to the ground to recover his breath. His sides compressed against the ground, forming love handles that quivered in from ragged breaths and gently flattened the random clumps of weeds dotting the area.

Settling down next to him, White Lightening indulgently lay his head on the horse's soft side and smiled from the feeling of his head sinking slowly into the soft layers of fat. The group waited until an hour after night, before they all got up and began moving past the abandoned site. A hundred yards into the woods, they unleashed a tittering bird call that echoed off the looming branches and was eventually joined by a return call of the same nature. A small glowing light appeared from behind a tree, and a young man in his thirties beckoned to them. The group approached the figure, whom both Tristan and Warren embraced. The man introduced himself as Trevor, the son of one of the retired soldiers' most trusted friends. Trevor was lean, and had an narrow face, dark eyes, and long hair. His eyes widened slightly at the sight of the rotund Maximus, but he said nothing. He then lead them to two ox-drawn carriages and had the three men crawl in one and the horses hunker down in there other. Maximus struggled to fit through the wooden partition between the floor and the bottom of the carriage, causing his belly to smash against the sides and groan a little from the compression. White Lightening helped push him in, before clambering in himself. Once they were secure, the carriages were off into the night.

The carriages bumped along for about an hour, stopping at various check points along the way. Eventually everything drew quiet, and the carts came to a final halt somewhere in the city.

The carriage partitions were slid open, and light poured into them.

What awaited the horses and the men?
15511122211222211111111111.title: They travel into the Kingdom and are holed up i...

choices: Maximus enjoys the contents of the shop
A guard loyal to the Captain makes trouble
155111222112222111111111111.content:
“Good evening,” a deep voice resonated in the abandoned street, as the five companions exited the carriage.

Tristan and Warren rushed toward the silhouetted individual as soon as their feet touched the ground and embraced their friend who was an integral reason for the ease of passage into the kingdom.

“Rupert,” Tristan exclaimed enthusiastically, “I cannot tell you how relieved I am to see you and your men.”

The man in question nodded, a wide smile adorning his face. “Of course old friend, I couldn’t stand idly by while that cur of a Captain twisted this city.” His gaze then shot up to the three well-known figures standing off to the side. “And you three are the ones with enough clout to stop it.” The greying man nodded in turn to the prince, the White Lightening and then to Maximus who elicited a hearty chuckle. “Mind you, this one seems to have plenty of clout under any circumstances.”

Maximus felt his rotund cheeks redden at the joke, and shuffled sheepishly in embarrassment. The movement caused his bulbous gut to sway gently, as if to further emphasize Rupert’s point.

“Alright,” the soldier clasped his hands, becoming dead serious in the process, “Let’s get going. We have a small, but well-hidden room for you all to spend the night. About an hour before dawn, I’ll have one of my men lead you to your positions in the Central Square and arrange for the Captain to pass through at the height of the morning market rush. You guys will do your thing, and we’ll get rid of this bastard once and for all.”

Simple, straightforward, effective; the companions were quick to accept the plan without hesitation and together they made their way into the safe house, although Maximus’ bulging sides made his entrance through the side door a little squished.

Once they were hunkered down, the men situated themselves in comfortable positions on the floor, while Maximus propped himself against the wall and White Lightening propped himself against the stallion’s plush belly. After the long day of travel, the group was asleep in no time.

Early the next morning, as dusk was barely suffusing the early morning gloom, the group was awoken by a gentle knock at the door. Blinking blearily, Maximus was quick to rise when he remembered their reason for being here. The obese horse had a pivotal role to play in the events to come, and he needed his mind to develop a razor sharp focus if they were to play the plan correctly.

Once everyone was up and ready, Rupert led them down into the square. Utilizing alleyways, side streets, and the emptiness of the early hour, they found their way into the square in quick fashion. After the group stopped, Rupert indicated to the different areas of the square. He didn’t need to explain its exact layout as everyone was already familiar with it, but he did point out the vantage points where each member would reside. Flynn would assume the identity of a street peddler in order to get in the captain’s path, White Lightening and Maximus would be sheltered in a small stable to the side of a large restaurant, and Tristan and Warren would simply behave like normal citizens as they weren’t too recognizable.

As the sun rose and the market place began to come alive, each individual kept their focus on the part they were to play. The signal to initiate the plan occurred around half past ten in the morning, as Flynn waved a bright red cloth in the manner of a merchant attempting to sell his wares. He kept his act up until he had a good view of the Captain slowly ambling down the northern stone steps accompanied by five of his closest men. Upon seeing the target, Flynn waited until the Captain was near the middle of the square before vaulting over his cart and ripping off his tattered disguise.

“CAPTAIN GLADE,” the prince shouted, loud enough to draw attention from nearby citizens, “I am decreeing your arrest for treason, attempted murder, and conspiracy by the power of royal declaration!”

The Captain was momentarily caught off guard by the prince’s sudden appearance, but he quickly regained his composure and yelled back, “You may declare those words, but they have no power ever since you were established an exile of the crown.”

Murmuring rippled through the crowd as the citizens struggled to anticipate which side was right. Flynn smiled knowingly, “Everyone here is surely aware of the Captain’s association with a horse known a White Lightening?” He called out.

The name drew a nod from the surrounding individuals, “Well he was being used in those staged accidents to increase the Captain’s hold on the security of this kingdom.”

The Captain scoffed, “And what proof might you have of this incredulous accusation?”
