Flynn smiled knowingly, “See for yourself,” he cried, spreading his arms dramatically.

On either side of him, an obsidian stallion and obese equine appeared. “I have the proof of the heroic horse known as White Lightening, and the assurance of the legendary Maximus. One of these figures you claim supported you, and the other being the very individual you tried to overthrow.”
Smiling widely, Flynn folded his arms in immense satisfaction, “What do you have?”

The Captain turned a deep shade of red, a frantic look in his eyes as he realized he was trapped. “I have this!” He exclaimed, drawing his sword which was accompanied by the unsheathing of five more. “You may have won politically, but I will be damned if you live to see the end of this day.” The Captain cursed the prince, “And that traitorous black runt,” he snarled at the obsidian horse.

“We’ll see,” Flynn drew a dagger and clashed with the Captain.

White Lightening took advantage of his speed once more and leapt into the air before taking two of the enemy guards down with each hoof. He landed on top of their chests and gave them each a strong knock on the helmet to ensure they would stay unconscious.

Maximus lumbered toward the guard closest to him and jerked his head back as the opponent’s sword grazed his muzzle. Stepping in as the guard followed through, Maximus butted him in the chest with his head and sent the guard reeling into a nearby stand.

The white stallion took a moment to register the prince currently grappling with the Captain before looking over his shoulder to see Tristan, Warren, and several men fighting their way through the crowd to assist.

The moment nearly cost Maximus his life as he felt a stinging sensation burn in his bulging side. He realized one of the two guards still standing had taken a wild swing and managed to draw a shallow cut along his bulging belly. Wheeling around, Maximus lunged at the guard only for the man to be swept off his feet in front of the white stallion’s eyes. He realized White Lightening had propelled a back hoof into the guard’s knee, hyperextending it and ensuring the guard would be unable to regain his balance. Maximus quickly brought a hoof down on his head, and knocked the guard out cold.

White Lightening seemed to be handling the final guard on his own, but Flynn was starting to lose the battle between dagger and sword. Suddenly the Captain swept the prince’s dagger out of his grasp and opened a shallow cut across Flynn’s chest. The prince stumbled to the ground and watched as the Captain raised his sword. Neither ever saw Maximus coming.

The bulging stallion launched himself in the air and landed squarely on the Captain, burying him under the equine’s large posterior. The humiliating defeat knocked the Captain out cold and Maximus took his time getting up.

The crowd cheered the group’s names, as Tristan and Warren finally made their way onto the scene. “Don’t worry,” Tristan gasped, “We have friendly soldiers and some medic coming shortly. Rapunzel is making her way down too.”

Flynn smiled at this last statement before passing out from the pain of his wound laid out across his chest.

A couple days passed for the horses and prince to recover. White Lightening had also sustained a sprained forelock from his stunt with the first to guards and had been too preoccupied to notice.

As they recovered, Maximus was offered his old post as commander back, but the stallion made it clear that he wanted White Lightening to occupy the post. He looked forward to serving as an advisor who could focus on certain other important things, like expanding his waistline once more.

Flynn returned to the loving arms of his wife and helped Tristan and Warren filter the guards to weed out those still under the Captain’s influence. As everything wound down, Tristan came to visit the two nearly recovered horses. “Thank you for all you’ve done. I think I still owe this one,” he patted Maximus affectionately on the belly, “A trip to my shop. I promised after all.”

The two horses looked at one another before nodding in turn, that sounded like a good option.

Was it, or did something else happen?
155111222112222111111111111.title: The expected group of allies

choices: They sleep and live peacefully with many more stuffings
The Captain breaks out and escapes, making the group hunt him down again
1551112221122221111111111111.content:
Several days transpired as White Lightening was indoctrinated into his new post, Flynn reunited with Rapunzel, Tristan and Warren rewarded for their efforts, the Captain appropriately trailed and imprisoned for his actions, and for Maximus to enjoy the freedoms of an advisor. Despite taking a step down from his exalted post as the Commander of the kingdom's security, Maximus was content in the knowledge that White Lightening would be more than capable of fulfilling the role and Maximus himself would be fulfilling other obligations.

After ensuring that the kingdom was in somewhat working order once more, Maximus took to thinking about where he would go from here. He kept up his usual eating habits and maintained a relatively neutral figure with a large, plush belly, chubby face and neck, and impressively proportioned posterior. He was quite mobile in his present state, but Maximus missed the experience of being able to stuff himself to his heart's, and belly's, content. Mulling the issue over in his mind, Maximus also thought back to the days when he was trim and as physically fit as White Lightening currently was. He did enjoy the strength and agility that went along with the notion of being in shape, but this sentiment was almost immediately quenched when Maximus indulged himself in simply feeling the weight swinging below his spine. He adored the pressure of being stuffed to the brim, feeling the tightness constrict in his middle, and being the heaviest entity in the area. The softness, the rounded stature, the cuddly image; Maximus realized he was simply delaying the inevitable by trying to convince himself otherwise. He went to get White Lightening one quiet night and decided to take Tristan up on his offer.

The two horses made their way down to the familiar's pastry shop, bumping into each other humorously and nodding gestures of respect to passing citizens who recognized the two famous horses. Eventually they came up to the entrance and made their way inside where Tristan seemed pleasantly surprised at their appearance.

"I was about to close down for the night anyway," he chuckled softly, before gesturing to the expanse of his shop. "You two have access to everything currently residing in here, including the display trays and the little something extra I made in anticipation for Maximus."

Reaching down behind the counter, Tristan pulled out an additional barrel of sweetened apple cider and presented it to Maximus in grand fashion. "A toke of gratitude and respect," the shopkeeper said, "The stand is also entirely full. Business was slightly slow today, so I hope you have a large appetite."

Already salivating at the aromatic fragrances wafting from the barrel of cider, Maximus reached into his side pocket and made Tristan take a large bag of silver for the contents. Although the shopkeeper blustered and protested at the offer, Maximus was even more adamant that he take it, utilizing his plush features to adopt a cuddly, pleading gaze which finally won Tristan over.

"That's not fair you know," the shopkeeper muttered with a smile, "But I can't fight you." He took the bag of silver with a sigh before bidding the horses good night and locking the doors to ensure privacy.

Finally able to focus on the food and drink, Maximus opted to eat one of the eight rows of confections before taking a deep draft of cider. For the first two partitions, the white stallion was fine, but his harness and side straps began creaking under the strain of containing the horse's expanding middle and Maximus' second drink from the barrel snapped the leather in quick succession. His unrestrained belly dropped several inches and wobbled ominously from the sudden release.

Sighing at the relieved pressure, Maximus waited for White Lightening to bring forth the next row of confections. He downed the third and fourth rows with relative ease, and shivered in delight as White Lightening gauged the increasing pressure with his muzzle. Maximus' belly grew tighter and rounded with the additional food, causing the fellow stallion's muzzle to slowly be pushed outward by the increasing pressure. By now, Maximus' belly was slightly resistant and wobbled from the additional liquid it held. His low-hanging gut swayed level with the equine's knees and bulged against Maximus' legs in tight creases. He was at a similar stage to when he had initially been stuffed during the initial hostage situation with the Captain.

Despite the incredible amount of food Maximus' belly, he was nowhere near as full as when he'd been stuffed to the same point days prior. He attributed this to the fact that his increased consumption had consequentially increased his capacity. With this revelation, Maximus became determined to finish the contents of both the stand and the barrel. Moving through the fifth row at a steady pace, Maximus' belly grew more taught and sagged lower and lower to the ground. White Lightening could only watch the process with incredulous awe, as his eyes traced the outline of the bulging mass slowly creeping towards the ground.

Halfway through the sixth row, Maximus found himself experiencing a sensation entirely alien to him; the floor brushing against his bare belly. Looking down, he realized his bulbous gut was pressing slightly against the floor and each additional bite caused his ponderous mass to spill out more onto the floor. Encouraged by the sight, Maximus plowed through the rest of the sixth row and well into the seventh row before he began to realize his belly was occupying a large portion of the floor in a rather spherical manner. White Lightening was entranced by the spectacular vision and could only imagine what the final state of the overstuffed horse would be like.

In his haste to finish the pastries, Maximus unintentionally abandoned the second half of the cider as he forged onward with the pastries. He was polishing off the rest of the final row, when Maximus realized his belly was pressing well against his spine to actually create an arch. His legs were also pushed out to the sides, and bulged into the soft, expansive flab with impressive results. White Lightening also buried his muzzle in the pillowy mound that was Maximus' stomach and was ecstatic to find that his muzzle was almost buried up to his eyes.

Breathing heavily, Maximus eyed the barrel and determinedly waddled over to finish his expansive quest. Titling forward, Maximus took deep, rolling drafts of the cider and White Lightening watched spellbound as the liquid level decreased in proportion to the swelling of the white equine's gut. As Maximus drank, his feet gently lifted off the ground and his full weight became supported by his staggering belly. He was, effectively and incredibly, immobilized by his large ballast of a gut. Once he finished, Maximus leaned back and burped politely, before rocking and sloshing on the quivering mass of his stomach.

Large love handles and rolls of flab formed from Maximus' weight, and his legs were forced outward at slight angles to rest on the plush expanse. Looking to White Lightening, Maximus smiled with the fullest expression he had ever witnessed, closed his eyes, and allowed his head to sink deeply into his soft, malleable chest.

Blinking from the awe-inspiring sight, White Lightening walked forward, lay his head on the sea of softness, closed his eyes, and drifted into a peaceful sleep of his own.

Where will you take the story next?

15511122211222211111111111111.content:
Maximus and White Lightening went through a similar feeding session many more times throughout their lives. The two remained good friends, and White Lightening always ensured the plush equine had enough to fill his voluminous gut. Maximus often had to be careful not to strand himself after consuming a particularly large meal. His large, swaying belly became a campaign and successful inspiration for Tristan's bakery which adopted a new logo: A large, well-rounded equine laying on the ground with their belly framed by a rising sun. He then went on to call it The Curved Crescent and gained a considerably larger business.

The legendary horse known for his legendary belly was headed for a future of excitement, food, plush sensations, and the accompaniment of a close band of friends. He only had to waddle to get there.

It was a fine fall day in the forest. And all the trees were losing their leaves for the winter season that is coming up. Even the animals are preparing for the winter season, too. Bambi, however, wasn't so sure about what he would do. After all, his mother made sure that her son was a good deer. But he would eventually make his decision about it.

One day, Bambi was playing with his friends, Thumper, Flower and Faline, like he would any other day. Then after quite some time, Flower tells him them something that surprises Bambi. "For the winter, I hope to gain some body fat so that I can hibernate all winter." "Yeah, I hope I can do just about the same, too." Bambi replied to them.

Just then, Thumper, who have heard what Bambi had said, suddenly had an idea. "Hey, Bambi. I have an idea. Why not I force-feed you to get you ready for the winter?" 15521121111.title: And so the Force-Feeding Begins...

155211211112.content:
Thumper took Bambi to a great open field. Far away from the forest but even farther away from civilization. Thumper placed the box in the middle of the humongous field. "I snatched this from some humans." Thumper said proudly, patting the machine.
Bambi inspected it and sniffed it, "Are you sure it's safe?" Asked Bambi, "Of course it's safe!, everything humans make is safe!" Thumper replied.

The machine was a small cube-like metallic box with human writing neither of the animals could read. "See, it says safe right here." Thumper pointed to a random location on the box, Bambi nodded in gullibility.

Thumper pressed a green button on the box, suddenly the box exploded forward into a large conveyor belt. Bambi was a bit taken back by all of this but he was still willing.
"Since this is a human contraption, it has human food. Any human food ya like will pop outta this thing." Explained the rabbit. "Now let's get to it." He tapped his foot rapidly in excitement and in impatience.

Bambi sat his thin buck-booty on the grass and watched in wonder as a singular cherry pie popped out of the machine with a playful whirring noise. The buck was a bit confused at first, but then he opened his mouth wide, and after quite a few bites he finished the pie.

"Oof, that was a lot Thumper, I think I'm done." Bambi groaned as he turned to leave.
"Nuh uh uh..." taunted Thumper, "It's called force-feeding for a reason." Thumper pressed a blue button on the box, robotic hands shot out from the sides and dragged Bambi back into place. They tangled like vines around his four legs, the deer bucked and retaliated but to no avail. "Hehehe I'm gonna make you bigger than the fattest bear!" Chuckled Thumper, a little creepily. Bambi struggled some more as he gulped down another pie.

155311.title: Meeko (The Raccoon)

1553112.content:
Here's my idea for a story in the sequel.

In the second movie Pocahontas travels to the British kingdoms to try and negotiate for peace between the two nations. While staying at a huge mansion her pet racoon Meeko decides during the middle of the night to sneak out from Pocahontas room, and visit the huge kitchen for some midnight eating.

Does that sound like a good story?
1553112.title: Pochahontas II

15531121.content:
He had only been here for less then a day, but Meeko the racoon could get use to this treatment. Ever since he and Pocahontas had arrived to the British kingdom they had been treated well, with good food and a nice house to stay in. The place was huge with every room having it's own treats. They had very comfortable chairs to sit on, and a bed that once he felt it never wanted to leave.

But there was only one other thing that he liked more then the bed, and that was the food they had. When they had been having dinner Meeko had catch the smell of something that he had never smelled before. It had been the smell of cooked meat, boiled vegetables and baked bread. All of it was like taken from a dream to him, and even thought he only got small samples of it served by his owner he that it tasted just as amazingly. He just knew he had to have more of this soon.

And later during the night when everyone else was asleep Meeko still couldn't stop thinking about all that food that could be stored in that room. Looking over at his owner he could see that she was sleeping as well, and decided to make tonight his chance to have something special for himself.

Sneaking out from his room he quickly remembered the way he needed to walk to get back to the dinning room. Once there he saw a huge door, from where during dinner he had seen people carrying trays of food coming from. "That must be from where the food come from." He quickly concluded, and made his way over there. To his luck he saw that the door was slightly open, and all he needed to do was to simply walk in to enter the pantry.

Inside he almost fainted by the sight he saw. The room was filled to the brim with all kinds of food. There was meat, fish, fruit, vegetables, bread, wine and much more. Not letting his growling stomach wait anymore he immediately started dinning on the first thing he saw.

First thing to enter his mouth was some grapes. Sweet as the berries of the forest Meeko gladly took and stuffed his face with as many of them he could before swallowing and going over to the next thing.

He liked almost everything he ate. If it was raw meat or just the sauce that was being served next to it didn't matter, he still loved it. The only thing that leaved a bad taste in his mouth was when he find some hot spices that on it's own just was an incredible burning feeling in his throat. He quickly had to drink something to get the fire inside of him out, and the first thing he saw was a huge vine bottle. After getting the cork of he drained it completely, making his throat feel better but now instead made him feel a little funny. Everything looked a bit dizzy, and he had some slight hiccups now.

As he was enjoying himself the most he could swear for a moment he heard something nearby. Looking back at the entrance he saw...
15531121.title: Some midnight eating.

155321.content: What would make this thing created by the gods themselves, wanna lose his godlike figure?
155321.title: Pegasus (The Pegasus)

1553212.content:
Hercules was really doing a great job in becoming the god he was meant to be.

He was killing Hydrant's, picking Golden Apples, and saving towns from all kinds of monsters when ever he could. He was pretty much the role model of the typical hero that everyone would want to become, and that everybody loved.

Or maybe not everybody, as in the deeps of the underworld a certain god of dead was not to happy at all over how things where going.

"Unbelievable!" Hades shouted as flames shot out of his body, and his otherwise usual blue flamed hair got red for a short time. "Here I am trying to make myself three course meal of chaos. One course Burned city's, One course drowned villages, One frozen army ship for desert (Filled up with real soldiers), and a glass filled with the tears from the few people that managed to survive all this."

"And what do I get instead?" He asked no one in particular before bursting out in flames again "A Hero Sandwich that comes in and serves me some Knuckle-sandwiches next to it!"

After getting (some what) calm again Hades's two henchmen Pain and Panic dared to enter the room. They both know all to well how their boss could be a bit "Frazzled" a times when things didn't go his way. (And since Hercules had entered the picture not much had been in his favour.)

"Bad luck again Hades?" Panic asked. (According to Hades he was never really losing anything he was aiming for, he just was having bad luck.)

"Is it that Hercules guy again?" Pain asked, and got quickly hushed by Panic. (The worst thing you could to was to mention that hero's name while he was still present in the room.)

"No! This time it was own brother Neptune that just decided to be a jerk to me, what do you think?!" Hades said to both of them, and they both transformed themselves into bugs, ready to get stamped on by their master for being so worthless. They often did that to get of pretty painless as Hades often just felt pity over how pathetic guys he had to work with. "Okay, okay, you two. Change back." He said and the two shape shifters did so instantly.

Hades then went over to his throne to rest a little. (Acting so over rage all the time could take a lot out of you.) As he did the two minions carefully walked over and waited permission from him to talk. "What?" Hades finally asked them.

"We where just wondering if there was any other plan you have tried on defeating..." Panic said before a angry stare from Hades made him stop saying a certain word. "You know who." Panic then said.

"And you don't think that's what I have been thinking about?!" Hades said in a not shouting tone, but still very loud and upset one. "I have tried every single trick in the book..." Hades said, before Pain interrupted with the question "What book?" "What book do you think? The 101 Ways for an evil overlord to conquer not only earth, but also heaven itself." Hades said and materialised a thick book out of thin air, before burning it up. "Oh, okay." Pain said, happy that he got an answer.

"But it doesn't matter since every time I try to make any of these plans to work He comes in saves the day, either alone or with his assistant flying horse!" Hades said, and went back to just being grumpy.

That was when suddenly Panic got an idea. "But what if he's in a situation where he would need the assistance of his horse friend, and he wouldn't be able to help him?"

Hades was first on his way to call what they had suggested as stupid, (Like he often did.) but this time it actually sounded like a good idea. "You're right." He said, barley able to believe his own words. "Without his trusty animal side-kick he would be much more vulnerable for further plans."

The only question now was "How was going to start this plan of making Pegasus less of the heroic animal that he was?" Hades or Pain and Panic?
1553212.title: It's a part of a new plan made by Hades.

choices: Pegasus uses the card later to call Hades.
15532121.content:
Given that he couldn't trust his two bumbling fools that called themselves "servants" with the simplest of tasks Hades knew he would have to take care of Hercules's trusty horse buddy himself, and he knew that with his all so often talented way of using words he could trick that dumb animal in no time.

Looking over what Hercules and Pegasus was doing at the moment he could see that the god son was on his way entering a temple to talk to the statue of his dad, all while his pet was waiting outside for his "Master". "This is so delicately put up for me, so how can I not take it?" Hades said as he teleported himself up to the land of the living.

As Pegasus was politely waiting outside for his friend to have his important talk with his God Father he suddenly spotted some red dot glowing on a tree trunk that was about 100 yards from the temple.

Very confused (But also curious) Pegasus made his way over to the glowing dot. As he reached the tree he decided to try touching the dot with one of his hoofs, but as he reached on hoof up and was just about to touch it, it suddenly disappeared!

Making the flying horse even more of a question mark then before Pegasus tried looking all around the tree to see where the dot had gone, and that's when he heard a familiar voice from behind. "This is actually much more fun then most people think." Looking behind he could see Hades standing there, holding a laser pointer in his hand.

Knowing very well that this guy never was good news Pegasus made himself ready to attack him, but that's when Hades put down his laser pointer and started doing what he did best. Negotiating.

"Hey there Pegasus! (I hope it's okay I call you Peg for short.) You may think that a individual of my kind would search you up to try and create any kind of "devise" to sabotage you and your abilities to help a certain "Son of the Gods" on his quest to return to Olympus." Hades said. He knew that he had such a silver tongue that he could basically start his talk with him saying what his plan was, and could still end up tricking the other one to do as he wanted. (Pegasus was so far still on his defences of what Hades had to say.)

"And you would be right, if not that I'm actually here to reward you." Hearing this made Pegasus lower his attack position slightly, as he didn't get what the god of death could mean. "Think about it my be winged stallion. You do pretty much half the work for him as you fly him into battle everywhere and assist him when you fight other flying creatures, like the Stymphalian Birds." Hearing this made Pegasus start to question all he had done with his friend so far. Had he really got all the credits he deserved?

"So all I came here to do was to give you this as a small gift from me." Hades said and held out a red apple. Pegasus at first was about to foolishly take the apple, until he realised just how easy of a trap this actually was. "Oh, no worries. This apple here is not poisoned or anything. This isn't like the story of Snow White." Hades said in a joking tone, and held out the apple once again.

This time Pegasus smelled the apple first to see that it was fine, and when it smell pretty normal he decided to dare tempt fait and ate it. It actually tasted really good, and the winged horse was enjoying the taste very much. What he wasn't noticing that Hades was looking at was that apple Pegasus had eaten was building a small bit of fat on his belly area. (Only about half an inch, but it was still something.)

"Did you like the taste of that?" Hades asked, and Pegasus nodded happily. "I would love to give you a whole basket of these apples if I had the time, but you master will soon exit the temple, and he might get suspicions if he saw you and me talking." Hades said, and this got Pegasus a little worried. (As he had completely forgot about Hercules, and almost thought that he was going to see them together.)

"So my suggestion to you is that you go back to him now, and when you have your chances to be alone I can send you some more treats to have. Does that sound good?" Hades asked, and Pegasus gave once again a over clear "YES" nod, as he really wanted to have more food to eat. "Great! Here's my card. Just call me when ever you want more stuff from me." Hades said as he handed out a business card to Pegasus (That he took with his teeth.), before going up in smoke.

As Pegasus was just about to go back to wait for Hercules, he could hear his voice saying to him. "Pegasus! What are you doing over there?" Pegasus was just about to run back to his friend when he remember that he still had Hades business card hanging out of his mouth. He knew that if Hercules saw it he would be a dead Pegasus, so he did the only thing he could think of doing with it. He stuffed it inside his mouth!

Wanting to keep his deal with the devil (Or in this case the god of death.) a secret for now Pegasus acted like it was nothing strange going on, and walked over to his human buddy. "Why where you looking at that tree?" Hercules asked, and Pegasus just did a shrug with his wings (As if to say "I don't know.") as his answer.

Hercules seemed to not think anymore about it as he climbed up on the back of Pegasus, and then he flew them both off.

As they where flying Pegasus could still feel the business card he had stored in his mouth, and was thinking about whether or not he should contact Hades again. What happen next?
15532121.title: Hades.

choices: Hercules is suspicious over what happen to Pegasus.
Pegasus enjoyed the feeling of being stuffed, and wants to feel it again.
155321212.content:
All of the sudden during the flight Pegasus and Hercules came into contact with a air pocket, that shaked them up violently for a second.

During that Pegasus jerked his head violently, and that made him accidently Swallow the business card he had been given by Hades!

When he realized what he had done, he looked down against his belly to confirm that the card now was there.

"What are you looking at Pegasus?" Hercules asked, and that made the flying horse immediately straight up his head again, and act like it was nothing.

But something was happening to him. Inside his stomach acids where starting to digest the card, and that was making it start doing "it's thing".

The whole plan with the card from the first place was that when Pegasus would want to contact Hades he would simply scratch it and POFF he would be there, and having the card getting broken down inside of him was more then enough to activate it.

One other small thing that Hades had done (That hadn't been completely thought out) was that he would appear where the card was. And since it was inside the belly of Pegasus, that's exactly where the god of death ended up.

From the outside Pegasus looked normal for one second, and then suddenly had his belly grow out 5 times it's size! And given that the Pegasus couldn't possibly support the sudden extra weight dragging under him, he started to lose control of his flying!

In a matter of seconds Hercules and his partner was plummeting down towards the ground, and no mater what Pegasus did he couldn't get himself back up straight!

Inside of the belly Hades tried to comprehend over where he was. He knew that he had only been given this to Pegasus, and therefore it was inside of the horse where he now was.

"But how?! Did Hercules figure out what we where planning and this is a legit way to get revenge on me, or is it just a very accidental (And surrealistic comedic) mishaps?" The god was asking himself, until he felt the half digested card in his hand. "The fact that Pegasus and Hercules is currently plunging through the air could also indicate that this must be the "accident" version."

He then thought about just letting them crash and die, but remembered that he made a fair deal with Pegasus. (And it wouldn't be nice to just ruining that deal like this, would it?)

So with a quick snap from his fingers he teleported himself out of the gut, and back into his underground lair.

With Hades out of his stomach Pegasus suddenly felt a lot more lighter, and manages to at the very last second break the speed just enough, and make a bumpy (But harmless) landing.

Once they where safe on land again...
155321212.title: Pegasus accidently swallows the card!

choices: Resting near the temple of Zeus after a long day’s work
Up on Mount Olympus enjoying festivities
15532122.content:
“Oh man, oh man,” Panic said nervously. “How’re we supposed to fulfill Master’s wishes?” He chewed distractedly on his fingernails before looking to Pain.

“Don’t look at me,” the red minion shrieked, “You were the one who said we’d handle it.”

“Now don’t be pinning this on me,” Panic yelped before drumming his fingers along his chin. “But since we’re already deep into this, we may as well come up with a plan.”

“Oooh,” Pain said, a jack-o-lantern grin splitting his face, “I like that.” He ground his claws against his head, seeming to think about the issue hardly. “And I think I have one!” He declared.

Panic folded arms dubiously. “All right,” he sighed, “Let’s hear it.”

“Well,” Pain said, “I say we lure the two of them down to the river with some story of a troublesome river god, and while Hercules fights the monster, we secure Pegasus and force him to face the river’s current. We make him open his mouth and tons of water will rush in. Pegasus’ belly will expand and grow wider and wider until it’s pressing against his legs and he can’t walk anymore, let alone fly! His stomach will be so large he’s resting on it and sloshing around like a water balloon.”

“That’s stupid,” Panic said, waving off the red demon’s suggestion.

“All right, you dumb gargoyle, let’s hear yours then,” Pain said, raising a resentful eyebrow.

“Well obviously, that arrogant horse loves godly foods. I mean he’s always pigging out at banquets and stuff. So we lure him away one night and get him alone. Then we tie him down and make him eat more and more food until he’s too fat to fly.”

Pain thought for a moment, “As dumb as you are, that might actually work,” he said.

“We’d have to make it progressive,” Panic said, thinking hard. “Perhaps one of us turns into an attraction for him, another pegasus, and we compel him to stuff himself. He won’t tell Hercules because he’ll be too embarrassed.”

Pain laughed at that. “I think that’s a good idea,” the red minion chuckled. “He’ll grow rounder and softer which will also breed mistrust between him and Hercules from secrecy.”

“Then it’s settled,” Panic said and the two clasped their hands evilly before flying into the night.

Where would they find Pegasus and Hercules?
15532122.title: Pain & Panic.

choices: Hercules sees Pegasus' belly the following morning and confronts the horse
Hercules is called away on a mission, and Pegasus continues to be stuffed
155321222.content:
The red and blue hued demons quickly searched for the heroic pair. They checked all the sights of the monsters Hercules had slain, before looking in the spots where Hades planned to unleash more trouble from the depths of hell. Finding no success the duo had no choice but to scale Mount Olympus and pray their evil presence didn’t incur the wrath of the gods.

After several hours of climbing, they final ascended into the realm of the heavens and left the common mortals and earth behind. Taking a moment to recover their breath, the two minions looked around in curiosity at a city they’d never glimpsed before.

Pockets of clouds laid in whisps on the lowest levels of the marbled floor. Obscuring the ground and providing an ethereal cushion for one to step on. Ornate and lifted pedestals, gardens, pathways, balconies, and other architecture dotted strategic points around the mountain’s plateau. There didn’t seem to be any activity taking place in the immediate area, but green flashes, boisterous noise, and pulsing music testified that the place wasn’t as abandoned as it seemed.

Hesitantly Pain and Panic drifted through the resistant layers of cloud and eventually crested a ridge that dipped into a large, central portico and lush olive trees surrounding it. Rich rose and quartz marble columns supported a decorative aqueduct that wound its way through the party scene; occasionally nectar and ambrosia descended in celestial cascades. Shifting frescos colored their ways across the columns in tune to the music.

The party goers glowed in numerous, spectral shades ranging from blood red to sapphire blue to deep purple. The coloration was a manifestation of both their powers and their personas, with the spectrum designating different meanings.

In the midst of the party, Hercules and his father strode among patrons and friends who offered compliments, congratulations, and witty gestures to the hero of Olympus. The bronzed Greek was basking in the moment as he reveled in the success of his latest accomplishments.

After observing the scene for some moments, Pain and Panic’s sharp, pointed ears perked up when they heard a booming laugh issue from the King of the Gods. “Ah son, I can’t begin to express my pride in your service to the kingdom.”

Hercules balked slightly as his father slapped is shoulder, but recovered with a shaky grin. “Thanks father,” the demigod said, idly rubbing his sore back.

“You deserve all the recognition you receive,” the white bearded deity bellowed, “I only wish your friend were here to enjoy the celebration.” Zeus looked to the sky, as if hoping to spot the Pegasus swooping in for a late arrival.

“He’s busy with the modeling of his new stable,” Hercules explained in a bored tone indicating he’d explained numerous times before.

“Ah, right,” the God of the Sky rumbled, before his smile brightened electrically. “But let this not stop us from engaging in the revelries.” And with that he guided his son to another group of friends.

Pain and Panic looked at each other in disbelief. The chances were almost too good to be true, and yet, they’d heard the words uttered by the ruler of the Gods himself. Shrugging they turned on heel and made their way back to the main center of the celestial city. Reading engraved Greek directions, they followed a cobbled pathway up to a large, arched building that hosted to brass doors with equine inscriptions on them. Together the demons pushed the grand entrance open and ventured inside.

The pair realized they might be recognized once inside, and Pain quickly transformed into a luminescent blue caretaker leading a gorgeous, brown and white Pegasus Panic by some reigns. They ventured into the rows upon rows of horse stables, each becoming grander and fancier than the previous ones. After several minutes of walking, they finally came upon their target. Pegasus was just putting the final touches on a luxurious, four room stable that appeared nicer than most nobleman’s homes.

Snorting in satisfaction as he nuzzled a painting into place, the winged equine stepped back to admire the work of art. Pain and Panic’s illusions both stared in wonder as well. The picture showcased Hercules riding astride a heroic Pegasus after a particularly important victory against the Hydra. Pain and Panic both rolled their eyes at the gaudy display of pride, but Pegasus seemed content in allowing it to serve as the center piece of his brand new stable.

Smiling with satisfaction, the winged hero turned his head and gave a slight start when he saw the illusions projected by the minions. His eyes grew wide and dopey from Panic’s simulated appearance, before Pegasus fluttered over like a dove and nodded his head in greeting.

Catching on, Panic nodded in return, feigning interest and admiration for the pure white stallion. Stepping forward confidently, Panic tried not to do exactly what his name entailed. He swallowed his pride, gritted his teeth and shook himself free from the reigns. “Go get dinner ready,” he whispered to Pain, before continuing into the apartment.

Pain nodded frantically, and hurried off as if he were some servant with pressing orders.

Panic went in and was introduced to the world of a hero. Prancing and playing the stereotypic role of a female besotted by a heroic male horse, the minion turned pegasus did his best to go along with Pegasus’ awful efforts at flattering.

The abashed stallion led the illusory female on a tour of his new palace, showing off the crystal pools spouting from a refreshing fountain in one room to the unequivocal views of the lounge area. Everything was tailored for the use of four legged steeds, and Pegasus reveled in his access functions usually reserved for humans and gods.

Panic couldn’t but be slightly impressed by the fancy settings, but he was well aware of his role and the end goal. Adopting a slightly bored demeanor, the brown and cream colored illusion seemed to only take interest in the final room Pegasus introduced: The kitchen.

Panic allowed his appearance to heighten her levels of interest considerably upon viewing the extensive dining/food preparation area. Whinnying encouragingly, Panic’s pegasus gestured toward the kitchen and winked seductively to the eager stallion.

Pegasus immediately picked up on the inclination and made for the pair to lay down on two plush, curved cushions situated around a marble and bronze table. Ringing a bell with one hoof, Pegasus nickered reassuringly that food would be arriving shortly.

Several moments later, a scrambling Pain dressed in the guise of a servant chef bustled in and made a large show of laying out an impressive amount of food. Once everything was set, Panic’s female took charge and began eating. Pegasus took the signal and began to eat heartily as well. They held a respectful silence for a little while, occasionally making eye contact, but mainly concentrating on their food.

After ten minutes, Panic finally allowed his alluring roan to issue a polite cough and signal that she was finished. Pegasus also seemed full and made to push his platter of vegetables away only to be stopped by Panic’s illusion.

The demon’s pegasus hypnotically padded over and picked up another bowl of assorted produce in her mouth. She pushed the bowl towards the stallion who, completely bewitched, took the food without hesitation.

Despite Pegasus’ trim stomach issuing a low growl to indicate that it was full, the stallion continued to eat more as he gazed entrancingly into the female pegasus’ encouraging gaze. As he ate, he failed to notice his belly slowly growing tighter and expanding roundly from additional food. His concave stomach slowly pushed out to swell into a faint sphere that only extended with the food being crammed into it. On and on the feeding session went, until finally, Pegasus’ swollen abdomen could hold no more.

Being a lithe, powerful horse meant the stallion could never afford to indulge himself in this manner. Only after he’d broken out of his daze did Pegasus realize his once in warding curving belly now protruded outwards in a smooth, taught foot wide globe. Gently, Panic’s roan nuzzle the tender surface of his bulging belly before turning on forelock and swaying hypnotically out of the room.

The stunned Pegasus could only stare on in wonder, his enlarged abdomen pressing into the cushion and arching his back slightly. As he looked on, his mind started to churn along again, and he slowly came back into the embrace of reality.

What would that reality be?
155321222.title: Up on Mount Olympus enjoying festivities

choices: The pair fatten Pegasus up in a series of increasingly larger meals.
Pegasus gets injured and is placed in their care as a patient.
1553212222.content:
Pegasus could barely contain himself in indignation from the way he'd been treated by the female Pegasus. He was a hero, a champion of the Gods and she'd treated him like some farm horse whose mental functions equaled that of drooling idiot. Pegasus reciprocated that last sentiment; he had acted like a drooling idiot, but the he'd been duped so easily caused worry to blossom in the heroic stallion's mind.

As he tried to figure out where he'd lost control, Pegasus attempted to adjust his weight. He shifted slightly, only to be impeded by something when he moved too far. Looking down, Pegasus moaned internally as he remembered the other aspect of his hypnotic date: His swollen belly stuck a solid foot out to the side and gurgled with any movement. Pegasus tried to calm himself, but instead he was hit with a trance as the fullness overcame him and he fell into a deep sleep.

Late the next morning, Pegasus awoke to find a slight crick in his neck. As he gently stretched and crack the sore joint satisfactorily, he noticed small rolls of adipose bunching around his shoulders. Looking further down, the white stallion gasped as he witnessed the small paunch that had formed between his legs. It bulged out slightly to the sides and wobbled faintly from the sudden movement. Shaking his head clear of the present issue, Pegasus slowly got to his feet and studied the room around him.

The table on which he and the female pegasus had dined still bore remnants of their meal, and the winged horse’s eyes widened at the volume of food he’d consumed. Snorting in contempt at his indulgence, the equine made to exit his apartment in search of the mysterious roan. As soon as he was departing the kitchen, he felt a pleasant nuzzle grace his smoothly curving abdomen. Jolting from the sudden contact, Pegasus turned swiftly to make eye contact with the familiar female pegasus. He made to gesture angrily at the female for abandoning him the night before, but was stopped short by the pleading look Panic conveyed in the roan’s eyes.

Gulping unsteadily, Pegasus was once more entranced by the sheer intrigue of the female equine’s disposition. She slowly lead him back into the kitchen with a coaxing smile, before indicating for him to lay down on the cushion. As soon as he made contact with the pillow, a chef bustled in wheeling a large cart and impressive bowl of soup on it. As the chef pulled the cart up, Pegasus mentally corrected himself. The bowl was more of a cauldron, and the female roan’s plans were pretty easy to guess at. Hypnotized by Panic’s beguiling demeanor, he slowly allowed himself to be spoon fed. Though the horse’s pride diminished slightly from the notion, he found the treatment a relaxing change of pace.

Panic tentatively had his avatar engage in bewitching the stupefied hero. The night before, the two demons had confided in the results of their first encounter with the legendary Pegasus. The two were slightly underwhelmed by Pegasus’ presence, but they agreed that they should keep up the romantic front in order to follow through with their plan. In order to keep the Pegasus off balance, they decided that sporadic feeding sessions and a small degree of intimacy were enough to distract the bewildered equine long enough for him to become hefty.

Presently, their plan revolved around a large cauldron of soup, an alluring roan, and the steadily swelling stallion currently laying on the cushion. With each bite, Pegasus’ abdomen bulged out a little more as the volume of soup increased. Slowly Pegasus’ belly began to fold over itself as from the sheer weight of the warm liquid.

Pegasus released labored pants as he powerlessly gulped down each ladle full. By the time the cauldron was three-fourths empty, the stallion’s gut bulged over a foot above his shoulders and quivered ominously. Once the rest was emptied, Pegasus unleashed a quiet burp and groaned from the fullness. Panic’s illusory roan gently pressed her muzzle to the horse’s distended belly and caressed it with a soft press of her nose.

The gesture was enough to sate the Pegasus into a lulling sleep, and Panic quietly retreated once more from the ornate apartment. Once outside, he turned back into his blue, demonic self and scurried over to an abandoned stall where the pair had taken temporary residence. Pain was waiting for him, and his face split into a wide smile.

“Looks like this will be much easier than we thought,” the red minion said with a chuckle.

“Indeed,” Panic agreed, “We just need to follow through and soon that cursed horse will be too fat to fly.”

The two laughed menacingly before plotting the next steps in their plan.

What would those steps be?
1553212222.title: Hercules is called away on a mission, and Pegas...

choices: They agree to increase the load of food and greet Pegasus with a big breakfast
They are caught by Pegasus who wakes prematurely
15532122221.content:
Together the duo decided to continue their plan with a series of fattening occasions for the unsuspecting stallion. Panic simply resumed his role of the alluring roan and Pain functioned as a convenient chef, servant, and owner of the imaginary pegasus.

The stallion himself awoke the next morning to find himself inexplicably full. He also felt sluggish and slightly disconnected from the world around him, and as the equine searched around the room in hopes of finding an explanation, his eyes soon settled on the cause. His belly had acquired an impressive layer of plush adipose overnight and was now pressed softly against the cushions. The mass between his legs rose several inches above his side and a thin layer of lard coated the rest of the horse's body.

Heavily clamoring to his feet, the horse swayed precariously from the newfound weight currently wobbling under his spin. Becoming increasingly alert of his surroundings, the usually lithe horse turned stark red as he realized his appearance was far different than the one present in all his prideful portraits. The embarrassed hero couldn't leave the stable in fear of the public catching wind of his new dilemma. With a pathetic sigh, Pegasus decided to take a refreshing walk around the vast corridors of his home and try to shed some of the excess with from his frame.

Walking had become a chore for Pegasus, as he soon found out when he was left breathless from a short walk that had taken him only a quarter mile. His sides heaved and quivered with each breath and soon the horse was forced to lay against a stall for support. He pressed one ample side to the wall and felt the fattened flesh squish against the painted wood. Once the he'd recovered from the unexpected exertion, Pegasus heard an eerie neigh emanate from further down the line of stalls.

His eyes rose and widened as he caught sigh of the attractive roan prancing away from him in intriguing fashion. Momentarily forgetting his distress, the gut heavy horse fluttered behind Panic's illusion and into a smaller, more reserved stall that functioned as the minion's fake abode for the attractive roan. It was outfitted solely to provide the heroic equine with plenty of food in order to ensure an expanded waistline and heftier disposition. The room was furnished tastefully with imaginative kitchen ware which included a small pantry, preparation table, and a main dining table where two large cushions resided for the comfort of the diners.

A large meal was played out once more for the Pegasus who actually managed to refrain himself from the sentiment of being stuffed for a moment, but was eventually overcome by the desire to please the alluring illusion.

Pegasus plopped his ample form on the seat and looked eagerly to the female equine. Panic made his roan amble her way around the table and begin the feeding process in short order. The two maintained another drawn out session for quite some time, Pegasus' belly swelling with each bite and growing increasingly tighter from the internal pressure. Salads, pasta, wine, breads, and cakes all traveled from the roan's loving offer into the cavernous gut of a stupefied stallion. Pegasus felt himself begin to be forced forward as his gut stretched deeply into the cushion and rounded him out further. He was growing larger by the second, but presently, nothing mattered other than pleasing the beguiling eyes of Panic's illusion.

Once the meal had finally commenced, Pegasus was once more rendered stuffed beyond his usual capacity and possessed a straining, creaking behemoth of a belly that rounded well above his shoulders in a makeshift horizon line. The dozing equine chuffed in pleasure as Panic had the roan press her muzzle once more the hero's taught underbelly.

As Pegasus drifted off into unconsciousness, Panic transformed back into his devious blue self and called out to Pain so they could discuss what to do next.

And what would they do next?
15532122221.title: The pair fatten Pegasus up in a series of incre...

choices: Pegasus and Panic's avatar have another stuffing session in the roman baths
They are interrupted by either Pain or someone else
155321222211.content:
Pain and Panic opted to allow the Pegasus to sleep on, while they planned for a large, impromptu meal to be readied in the morning. At the moment, the famed stallion was laying on his side; a crevice of fat running the length of his spine and rounding out in a swollen, softened rear. His dome of a belly extended a foot from his flanks and contracted with steady, rhythmic breaths. They would wait until the next morning to continue.

Panic aided Pain gathering a veritable cornucopia of foods. Sweetened breads, hot chocolate, grapes, spiced delectables, and numerous other foods were gathered on a silver platter for the hero's enjoyment. Pain reverted into his chef's form as the sun began to rise, and Panic transformed once more into the spellbinding roan whose appearance caused an exceptional amount of intrigue and transfixion on Pegasus' part. As the winged equine stirred, he placed one hoof firmly against his softened chest and felt a downy wind sweep lightly over the plush surface.

Looking up, the hero smiled as he was greeted by Panic's avatar which gazed flirtatiously back to him, while the residential chef scurried about in order to lay out another abundant feast. Pegasus moaned lightly as he struggled to right himself up, feeling his belly compress into gently rolls that added a curly texture to the usually smooth curve. His shoulders and ribs also contorted in a display of pudgy horse flesh, but eventually the white stallion managed to struggle and triumph over his ponderous middle.

As he righted himself to a more dignified position, the bloated equine was greeted with the familiar sight of an ornate layout of various foods delicacies backed by the illustrious roan engineered by the deceptive Panic. He felt a faint pang of reluctance emanate through his bulging form, but one quick glance into the female horse's beseeching gaze and everything subsided to the usual eagerness to appease the mysterious figure.

Each bite was accompanied by an affectionate nuzzle to his midriff, which provided bouncy resilience and texture thanks to the ever increasing volume of food accumulating within it. Pegasus felt his stretched middle grow tighter, and Panic's avatar began to indulge him in soothing, gently strokes with her nose that pressed lightly into the taught flesh and displaced his engorged middle in wide, shallow trenches. Pegasus moaned in delight from the euphoric sensations, while simultaneously taking on additional weight to accompany his slowly swelling stature. The crest on his back shivered with wobbling mannerisms as he reveled in the cyclical treatment of being stretched and then relieved by Panic's expert motions.

As the ridiculously large pile of food dwindled to nothing more than crumbs, Pegasus' bulging side crawled higher into the air and formed a steeper, more prominent slope that angled itself proudly into his creased flanks and softened chest. He found his forelegs spread gently by the ample pressure exuding outward from the incredible influx of food, and he managed to wiggle one feebly in order to convey his stuffed, but sated state. As he forced the last portion of bread past his maw and felt his middle creak with the ensuing pressure, Panic settled the roan's gaze directly in front of his. The hero made to loll off once more into a stuffed unconsciousness, but Panic nudged and nipped him into standing position. The fattened horse moaned at the request, but rose altogether.

He shivered from the incredible weight curving beneath his padded spine, and stumbled a few steps before Panic set his roan into support mode and rested her trim figure against his taught one. With a wide eyed glance, he looked in wonder for a place to rest and was guided by the roan into another chamber of the apartment where an ornate fountain trickled lullingly into a wide, mosaic Roman bath. Pegasus realized the water would be perfect to alleviate the sagging heft of his midsection from his poor, overstuffed physique and was quick to enter the calming water. He sighed as the bubbles caressed his rounded side and began to ease the tightness into softness as he was greeted by the exceptional sensations and drifted into a hypnotic experience.

As he looked to Panic's roan, the avatar was running through options and planning on how things would transpire.

How would they?

Panic’s roan looked over the obese equine. He was massive, close to becoming an immobile blob of horse fat. Panic realized, that he could trap Pegasus in the Roman baths if he made him a little bigger.

The roan nuzzled Pegasus lovingly and then took to the kitchen. While in the kitchen, he morphed back into Panic.

“Omigods omigods! So close! I have to make this quick otherwise that fat beast will realize what’s going on! Ahh!” Panic created a meal far bigger than anything else Pegasus was served before, Panic put extra ambrosia in it on accident.

He morphed back into the roan and went back to the tubs, he saw obese Pegasus, almost too fat to move in the middle. The roan joined him in the tub and began to stuff him silly with massive cakes, pies, wine, cheese, breads, pastas, soups, and salads. Pegasus closed his eyes waiting for the feeding to cease, he was too tired and much too fat to retaliate.

Suddenly, his ears perked up, his stomach grumbled louder than a Hydra. Panic stopped feeding him for a second. He was way too fat to get up, but he would drown if he didn’t do anything. Pegasus began inhaling the water as much as he could. It was almost never ending. He felt himself get bigger and fatter every second.

1553322111.content:
It was a regular day in Lilo's house. Except today, Lilo and Nani went on a three day vacation. Not to mention Jumba and Pleakly going out on some intergalactic convention in space. So everyone was gone, expect for Stitch. Stitch had the house to himself. The reason why he wasn't in a.....travel mood lately. Nani didn't really trust Stitch by himself because he might wreck the house. But Lilo did trust Stitch and knowing even if he did made a mess, he would clean up easily.

Stitch has just got out of bed and he was pretty hungry. He went down to the kitchen to get some food from the fridge, only to find the fridge with chains and locks.

"WHAAAAAATTTTT?" Stitch said seeing a locked fridge.

There was a note on the fridge. Stitch read the note and it said:
Furball, don't even think about raiding the fridge. If you get hungry, there are a few bags of dog food. Nani.

Stitch wasn't too happy about the note. He then looked at the dog food and tried it. To him, it tasted like sawdust.

"Yuck! Eek!" Stitch said after eating the horrid food. He then look at the fridge again.
"Bahhh! No lock can hold Stitch." Stitch said clawing at the locks. Usually Stitch can break anything, but these locks were still intake.
"What the?" Stitch couldn't believe it. Then he looked at the P.S. of the note.

P.S: I had Jumba made special chains and locks that even you can't break. So good luck with that.

"Gaaaaahhhhhhh!!!!!!" Stitch yelled realizing that he was stuck with that sawdust to eat. "What to do? What to do?" Stitch had to think about what to do about food. Then, a certain cousin came to mind. "Frenchfry!!!!!"

If you don't know Frenchfry, he is a cook-like experiment with a french accent and as well as a high class cook. He can practically make food out of nothing. The side effects to his food was massive bloating and not feeling full from eating. After a battle with Nani, he promised not to try to cook people anymore. Even know this, Stitch still called his cousin over.

After a few minutes, Stitch brought Frenchfry over and to Nani's Kitchen and explained his siuation.

"So, can Frenchfry help Stitch out?" Stitch asked.
"Of course. I live to cook and serve." Frenchfry said.

Frenchfry started to spin like a tornada cooking at rapid speed to make breakfast for Stitch. He fried some eggs, made some hashbrowns, several stacks of bacon, and huge stacks of pancakes, waffles, and french toast (of course). He placed all the food on the table, ready to eat. It was enough food to feed a family of 10 and it was just for Stitch.

"Bon appeitee!" Frenchfry said to Stitch.

Stitch pretty much drooled down to the floor for 10 seconds. Then went straight for the food. Stitch started with a few slabs of bacon and enjoyed the fatty, salty taste. Next, he goes for the hash and eggs. Not even using a fork. Then he grab some maple syrup and poured it on top of the waffle, pancake and french toast stacks that were taller than he was. After he was done adding syrup, he attacked the stacks.

"So good." Stitch said eating the pancake stack. But as he has eating, he didn't realized that his stomach was starting to gain rapid amount of pudge. Frenchfry's food still had the same effect as before.

15533222212222.content: How about Buster, the antagonist of the sequel?
15533222212222.title: Buster.

choices: Adopted by a family that spoils him with food
Stuck in the pound,stealing and eating other dogs food
155332222122221.content: What will the situation be?
155332222122221.title: Yes

1553322221222211.content:
Buster pondered his life. It was a sad little life in a sad little shelter with no friends. The employees of the shelter quickly realized that Buster wouldn't get along with any of the other dogs and quickly learned to isolate him from the other dogs. Buster wanted companionship but realized that he only knew how to manipulate and control other dogs. He grew cynical; he didn't eat, play, or walk. But he always eventually ate. His nature, his drive for food was still a goal. He didn't have the life of luxury some dogs had; nor did he think he ever would.
         Buster might not have been the first dog to hear the car pull up, but he certainly did. He tried to suppress hope, but to no avail; deep down, he knew that he wanted to be adopted. He suppressed his optimism and let out a chuckle. Then he saw her. She appeared to be a rich woman with a rich husband. She was dressed simply, but elegantly and her husband dressed similarly for a man. They were both thin, but with a miasma of cigarettes that made Buster's nose crinkle a tad. He watched the couple guardedly, with intense suspicion but made no overt aggressions. He made no pretenses of cuteness because he knew he wasn't competitive with puppies.
         After a few passes by, the woman finally noticed Buster and eyed him with curiosity. The pound woman explained how Buster fared with other dogs, but the woman was having none of it, insisting that she wanted a fierce dog to protect her from potential criminal-types. Buster still made no signs of aggression, only weariness and caution. The woman seemed to like Buster instantly, so she summoned her husband to look at Buster. He elicited the same response his wife had made, and they decided to adopt Buster.
         "He seems like a big strong dog," Sherry, the woman who had adopted Buster, said, seeming to admire, but not fuss over Buster in a way Buster found genuine and soothing. He knew instantly that this human was his type; and her husband was a detached, calm, rational man who was deliberate, firm, and consistent in the same way his wife seemed admiring. Buster liked him too. The only criticism the man, called William, had for Buster was, "he's a bit gangly. I always imagined a guard dog being a bit more stocky." Sherry nodded at this but replied, "True, but we have remedies for being skinny, Bill. That's not difficult at all."
         The house where the car stopped was a medium-large house with a cast-iron gate and a victorian design. Buster had no idea where he was. It was obviously some suburb, but Buster hadn't a clue where. It didn't really matter to Buster. Buster was housebroken and new very rudimentary commands like "sit," "stay," and "come." But he was otherwise untrained.
1553322221222211.title: Adopted by a family that spoils him with food

15533222212222111.content:
William and Sherry had two children: Paul and James, their two sons. Paul was a tall, thin child who was scholarly but immensely kind. Buster found James more irritating, loud, and adventurous. Buster could live with that. But Buster heard another sound: the dropping and clatter of food pellets into a bowl. It was repeated a couple more times before Buster heard the sound of the bowl scraping the floor. He ambled down the stairs, still cautious about his new family, but immediately went into the kitchen, where he first smelt the other dog.
         Buster began to growl before William smacked Buster on the head and told him to stop growling. Buster whimpered but obeyed. The other dog was already eating when Buster walked in. Buster stopped and waited. The other dog was apparently a German Shepherd or Belgian Malinois, probably the former; but he, Buster knew instinctively the other dog was a male even before he had confirmed, seemed different from every dog Buster had ever known. Buster had known German Shepherds, but none had been this large.
         Eventually, the other dog finished his bowl, looked up, and saw Buster. "Oh," he began sheepishly, "oh excuse me, how rude of me. You must be the newcomer here. I'm sorry, well, this is inconvenient. I'm sorry, my name is Clarence," the German Shepherd introduced himself thus and sat down gingerly, like it was a mild discomfort to sit. "Yeah, um, call me Buster," Buster replied, taken aback by the apologies he had just heard, "Do you think we could get more food?" Clarence chuckled and beamed, "I like your thinking. Let me show you how." He started barking, and in a couple of minutes, Paul had come in and refilled the bowl. This time, Buster drained the bowl, "I was famished," Buster grinned sheepishly. He was no longer ravenous and was about to walk off when Clarence called him back.
         "Where are you going? Aren't you still hungry?" the large German shepherd asked with a bewildered look. "Can we get more?" Buster asked incredulously. "I usually get seconds, thirds, and on occasion, fourths," came the reply after a pause. After a chorus of barking, James came and filled the bowl but stayed in the kitchen. When Clarence had finished the bowl, James took it and filled it again. Buster started his own second bowl with the same zeal he had stsrted his first bowl with, but only got three quarters through it and only barely managed to finish it, having been put almost into a food coma by rating that much.
         James filled the bowl a couple of more times before he felt Clarence lie down next to him. Buster dozed for what seemed to be a while before he felt Clarence nudge him. "Come on, the humans are eating." Buster was furious at Clarence for his interrupting Buster's sleep; he had no idea why Clarnence would do this. "Why do you care?" Buster asked, thoroughly irritated. "Have you ever had human food?" Clarence asked. When Buster shook his head, Clarence replied, "it's to kill for. Come on."
         The humans were indeed just beginning to eat. Buster nestled between Paul and James while Clarence perched between William and Sherry. James was quite generous with his food, Paul was not so much. But it seemed that every other bite James slipped food to Buster. Human food really was to kill for, Buster discovered. The morsels of everything James and Paul dropped were seemingly divine. Buster had never believed in a higher power than himself, but now he absolutely wanted to.
         Clarence got lucky, but his share wasn't nearly as lucrative as Buster's share; and Clarence seemed disappointed afterwards. Buster had a small suspicion that perhaps he had overextended himself, but he immediately dismissed the thought. He would eat less the next night, he thought to himself.
15533222212222111.title: Explore the new house.

155332222122221112.content:
Buster grew to enjoy Clarence's company, but the day to day life for Buster seemed rather boring and routine. One day, Buster plucked up the courage to ask Clarence a question, "So what was your life like before you came here?" Clarence, who had been trying to groom himself, looked up, and frowned, "What do you mean? Except for a time that I don't well remember as a very young puppy, I've lived here all my life, according to Sherry and William, all four years of it. Why? What happened to you?"
         Buster proceeded to tell Clarence about his old gang, their adventures, and the life he had led before the pound. "Then," he concluded, "William and Sherry picked me up at the pound and the rest is history as we know it." Clarence nodded, but kept a pensive tone, "I much prefer life here, where I'm fed and loved. I dislike change and disruption." Buster appreciated his friend's response, but wished Clarence had understood his situation better.
         Clarence went back to cleaning himself for a little while before he asked Buster, "Hey, Buster, can you scratch my back?" To Buster, this seemed like an odd request, not malignant, merely like a tomato and peanut butter sandwich odd. Buster hestitantly obliged.
         To Buster, Clarence seemed soft, but not because his hair was soft, if anything, it was bristly, but becuase it seemed that his skin gave way to pressure far more easily than Buster's own skin did. Buster did think, however, that his own skin had become more soft lately; perhaps it was a result of being an inside dog. Not that it much mattered, Buster thought to himself, but Clarence seemed bigger than Buster was, the latter thought to himself. But when they stood next to each other, they were the same height, Buster even thought that he was a tad taller. But Buster observed Clarence more and tried to deduce the cause of their differences.
         Buster watched as Clarence stood up. Clarence appeared more rounded than Buster, but not in the same way Buster was round. When Clarence stood, his abdomen appeared cylindrical, but with little rolls of skin jiggling slightly as he walked, and when he sat, those little folds merged into bigger rolls. Buster had no idea what caused this. He had never seen anything like this on any dog before. Buster looked at himself, and was surprised to see that the very distinct hourglass shape he had once had had grown less pronounced, an effect he attributed to being an indoor dog.
         That was the only difference that Buster could determine was different between his form and Clarence's. "I was curious," Buster queried Clarence later that day, "do you like exploring the neighborhood?" Clarence turned and replied, "…
155332222122221112.title: Buster never quite settles in.

1553322221222211121.content:
It was a crisp autumn morning, a beautiful day for a walk around the neighborhood, Buster thought to himself. Clarence seemed to agree because he exhorted Buster, "Come on, let's go see the neighborhood!" Although it was technically illegal, no one patrolled the neighborhood looking for dogs without leashes. Also, Buster realized, he had a collar, with his name and address on it; so if he got lost, people would know where to return him.
         Clarence squeezed through the doggie door with a huff, and Buster followed afterward. "Come on, let me show you Dave's house." Buster had no idea who Dave was, but he sensed that Dave had a personality similar to Clarence's. A few houses down the block, Clarence stopped and declared, "Here we are!" Buster, however, couldn't help but notice how Clarence's voice sounded a touch labored, like he was almost panting.
         Clarence led the way to Dave's back yard. When they reached the back door, Clarence called in, "Dave! I hope you don't mind that we're here." Then, Buster heard scrambling of a dog's nails on a hard floor, "Give him a moment; he's an old man; so he gets a bit stiff." About a minute later, a head with black hair as long as Clarence's sticks its head through the little doggie door. "Dave!" Clarence calls, to which the dog head responds, "What, Clarence? I was taking a nap. Oh, hello there," Dave apologized, only then noticing Buster, "and you are?" After Buster had introduced himself, Dave welcomed them inside.
         Buster recognized Dave to be a flat-coated retriever, but only just. When he walked, Dave's midsection swayed from sighed to side in a rhythmic motion with his stride. And when he sat, Dave's midsection folded into a moderate-sized pad of flesh. Dave didn't walk very far because his food bowl was only a few paces away from the door. But it was full of the same food Buster and Clarence were accustomed to eating. A woman sat in the next room with the noise box on in the background. Dave offered his guests something to eat.
         Despite having eaten breakfast not long before, Buster decided to offer to Clarence the first go, "I can always get more if you want," Dave said nonchalantly but pleasantly. Clarence decided to eat first, so Dave called in the woman from the next room with a short bark. When the woman came in, she seemed surprised to see Buster, but refilled the bowl and watched the dogs eat in turns, even feeding Dave little bits of cold cuts and candies when she wanted to.
         Having gorged themselves, Clarence and Buster decided to…
1553322221222211121.title: …Sure."

15533222212222111211.content:
Clarence decided then that it was time for he and Buster to go home and said so. Clarence squeezed through the doggie door out of Clarence's house and Buster followed. Buster turned and watched as Dave tried to squeeze through the doggie door. But despite his best efforts, Dave couldn't squeeze through the doggie door. Eventually, he stopped trying and started panting, in full view of Clarence and Buster. Eventually, the woman who had fed them came and opened the door for Dave, who hobbled down the stairs, mozied over to where Buster and Clarence had stopped, and sat with a dull thump and a pant.
         "Bye, guys, sorry I'm not in the shape I used to be. I'm afraid getting around has become more of a hassle lately, but good night!" he said all this with small pants interspersed, as if walking that far had winded him. Buster and Clarence said their goodbyes, leaving the monstrous dog panting and sitting where he was. And when Buster glanced over his shoulder, he saw Dave exert himself trying to heave himself up. Buster thought it was sad that such a magnificent dog should have to end like this. But he knew that such things were inevitable and that Buster was just a bit earlier than some. That happened with bigger dogs.
         Dinner came in due course; and Buster's selfishness allowed him to sit between Sherry and James, the two most generous givers of food. And William had even brought home a burger and fries for Clarence and Buster, in addition to their usual food and table scraps. Buster ate with a zeal he had never known before. He was bored, and his only entertainment was food, so he ate more. Before long, when Buster stood, he had a boxy appeance similar to Clarence's.
         But Buster was bored; he still longed to roam around and meet new dogs. Clarence only knew Dave, but Buster got quickly bored of just those two for company. So he went out looking for other dogs on his own. There were other dogs in the neighborhood, but very few were off leashes and roaming around. And to Buster's disappointment, none of them was a female. Buster dejectedly walked toward Dave's house.
         Suddenly, Buster saw another dog not on a leash. It was probably a golden retriever, but Buster wasn't quite sure. Buster did notice, however, that the other dog had the same stocky build that Buster himself had. The square abdomen with no tuck-up, the soft flanks with no visible ribs. "Good morning," the other dog began, everything was so formal here, Buster thought to himself, so pretentious. When Buster realized that the other dog was walking in the same direction he was, Buster struck up a conversation.
         "So," Buster began, "where are you headed?" The retriever thought for a moment and replied, "I guess Dave's house." Buster grinned, informed the retriever that he was heading there too before the other dog looked up suddenly, "Excuse me, I'm Gary, I live right down the street." After Buster had introduced himself, the pair walked in silence for a moment before Gary stopped to sniff a pile of grass. "Sorry, thought that I smelled a cat, nevermind." Buster then heard a faint sound like nails on a pavement. He turned and saw Clarence running, no, Buster thought, bumbling, to try and catch up. Despite having run less than 100 yards, Clarence was struggling to catch his breath; and when he recovered, he panted, "Sorry, I haven't run like that in ages."
         Buster felt sorry for Clarence for a bit before the trio was heading to Dave's to get food. Dave must have heard them approaching because he got the woman they all knew to let him outside. But when Dave saw them, he looked worried: "Guys, I can't feed all of you, sorry. I don't have enough food. But I do know of a place where I'm sure we can get enough for us all. There's a deli near here, just a couple blocks that way. I can show it to you if you want. I used to, before my masters got their nanny for their kids, go down there quite frequently. Now, with my joints the way they are, it's too much effort. I guess I haven't been there in six months to a year. Yeah, it's been a while."
         And with that, Dave…

15533222221221.content: Is the weight gain something that affects the character of Thunderbolt in the show, or the acting dog offstage?
15533222221221.title: Yes.

choices: Stay with Rolly, and see what adventure fat Thunderbolt is having on tv.
Cut to the actor Thunderbolt backstage.
155332222212211.content:
(This story takes place after the first movie.)

The Dalmatian pups where all gathering around the TV to see their favourite dog in action. "Thunderbolt". The dog that gets past every obstacle, beats all the odds, and fight crimes like no other. His show was like a typical serial, being told in short exciting episodes, and always ending in an exciting cliffhanger to have audience come back to see next episode.

They have watched it for several seasons, and as the pups grow older more and more of them started to see the "cheap factor" of the show. They started to get a learn on what "bad acting", "bad scripting", and "bad production" was, and suddenly the show didn't seem that good to them anymore.

But what had made most of them definitely feel "to old for this show" was the latest season's storyline. It was told that while trying to stop a crazy scientist from testing his new "experimental ray" on a tied up woman, Thunderbolt had been hit by it instead and ended up being...FAT! For the rest of the season Thunderbolt will have to do his best at trying to be a hero while carrying around all of his extra weight.

For many of the Dalmatian puppies this was just "to stupid" for them to watch, but for one young Dalmatian this was an eye-opener of a season, and that pup's name was Rolly.

Rolly had always been a very pudgy pup, and for most times he felt like he it was a disadvantages, and that he was never able to do anything great. But this new season was showing him a whole new perspective on what fat dogs can do.

Many of his brothers and sisters thought he was weird for still watching the show when it "wasn't even trying anymore" to them, but he didn't care. Fat dogs had someone they could look up to and be inspired by, and that dog was Thunderbolt.
155332222212211.title: Every fat kid's hero.

choices: Go back to Rolly in front of the TV.
1553322222122112.content:
"And cut. Let's take fifteen minutes break." The director called, as the cast and crew took their small break.

Among them was Thunderbolt, who was looking more forward to this then anyone else. Even thought he looked very fat on TV Thunderbolt actually was still his slim action self, but he was now wearing a fat-suit when doing his acting.

It wasn't a comfortable thing to wear, since it made him feel just like he was carrying all that extra weight, and it also affected his movement a little. It took him about a couple of hours to get it on, and just a little less time to get it off.
