         Thunderbolt awoke when he was hungry, like he usually did. He scratched himself, took his time standing, and meandered over to the food trough. Rolly was already there, seeming to wait for Thunderbolt. Rolly stood awkwardly. "Ok. So, do you want to ease into this diet or do you want to go cold turkey?"
15533222221221212211111111122212111.title: "Yes."

1553322222212211.content:
Maggie had seen that grace had started to become a bit rounder lately and she went to ask her what had been happening to her.

Grace said that she wanted to see why Maggie was so happy with her size, so she had to find out why being fatter was so much better. She had started to eat a lot and started to develop a hanging gut, and to her surprise she love it! She loved the feelings she got when walking around in her new state, and seeing her new big belly swing from side to side with every step. She gave Maggie a show of showing her new body to her, and Maggie could see just how happy Grace looked now. "So I guess you liked it?" Maggie asked. "YES! YES! I just love it!" Grace said jumping around with joy, "I just wish to become a large as possible!"

"Well, You still will never be bigger then me." Maggie said to herself cocky, which Grace heard. "Hey! I bet I can be twice your weight by tomorrow night!" Grace said back challenging. "Oh really?" Maggie said back. "Really!" Grace answered back quickly. And so the bet was on where both Maggie and grace went their own ways to try and find things to eat to make them bigger then the other.

As they started Grace knew this wasn't going to be easy to win. Both she and Mrs Calloway had made many jokes about Maggie's giant size for a good reason, and that reason was because she was that giant size. Even if Maggie didn't eat anything during the whole time the bet was on, she was still three times the cow that Grace was now. And while Grace still was usual self with just big potbelly, Maggie was a walking lard piece, with all of her body being fat and thick. She knew that if she wanted to win she had to find some place where there was lots of food, and where no one would ever think about looking for her.

Maggie on the other hand didn't seemed as much bothered as she thought that with her current size that she had been having for many years she would be winning easy. Still she felt that perhaps there would be something that could lead to defeat, but she couldn't figure out what.

Later that night both cow finally figured out just what they had been thinking about earlier. The pantry! That place had a lot of food stuffed inside, and whoever ate there would be guaranteed a victory in this bet. Grace thought that tonight would be her only chance to do it without having anyone else knowing anything about it. She knew that both her and Maggie where sleeping in stables right next to each others, so she needed to keep it quiet so she didn't wake her up. Carefully she made her way out of the barn, and started to head to the pantry to eat more then she had ever eaten in her whole life.

choices: The necklace causes Robin to feel strange
Robin heads home, where Maid Marion is waiting with dinner
15533222222211221.content:
One day in the woods, Robin was heading back home after a slow day in the village. He had mostly just been staking out the latest movements by Prince John and his men, taking the occasional break to pilfer the pockets of the occasional guard. Flipping one of the few coins he had held onto in his hand after dropping the rest off at the church, he thought he saw something nearby. When he stopped by to look, the fox broke out into a grin. A raccoon was out cold propped against a tree, every breath a deafening snore. Two things in particular caught Robin's attention - the raccoon was massive in weight, easily twice the size of Little John or the Sheriff. It looked as if his clothes had nearly managed to stretch out to his size, too, the shirt larger than expected but straining at the raccoon's gigantic gut, the pants struggling to contain his massive legs.

More importantly, Robin noticed that the raccoon had a decent pile of gold as well as one larger and oddly-shaped gold piece on a necklace. Robin smiled to himself as he relieved the obese sleeper of about half of his money - he wasn't completely heartless - and grabbed the necklace off his chest, trying it on himself. Robin slowly walked away, the necklace swaying to and fro with every step.
15533222222211221.title: Yes.

choices: see what Little John cooked up for dinner...
155332222222112211.content:
After a few minutes with the coin around his neck, Robin could feel a slow, strange feeling creeping across his body. It was not strong - he really only felt it when he stopped walking for a moment to think - but it was enough to confuse him anyway. His recent theft victim was the biggest person he'd ever seen before... but who's to say he didn't get that way from years of overeating? Mostly confident that it was just him worrying about nothing, the fox continued down the path, blissfully ignorant of what exactly he had bouncing off his chest.

A few hours passed as Robin carried out general reconnaissance on the area, taking note of the latest activity from Prince John and the Sheriff's men and working out strategies for upcoming heists against the king's gold. He was so caught up in doing this that he didn't notice his body slowly growing. At the end of the day, he was nearly 10 pounds heavier since he had picked up the coin, but the fox was so lanky normally that it was barely noticeable regardless. Reaching camp, an exhausted Robin decided to...
155332222222112211.title: The necklace causes Robin to feel strange

choices: Robin says they can use it to incapacitate Prince John
Little John says they can use it to help disguise Robin
1553322222221122111.content:
Walking into the camp proper, Robin saw Little John relaxing next to a fire with a pot cooking on top of it. "Hey, Foxy!," the bear called out. "You're just in time for some grub!"

"What exactly is on the menu for tonight?", Robin asked as he walked over to his friend.

"I was able to scrounge up some meat from the market and a bunch of vegetables from the royal garden, so we've got a nice and hearty stew going," Little John replied.

"Fantastic," Robin replied as he sat down on a log nearby the fire. Over the course of a few minutes, Little John had finished the stew and poured out some strong helpings for the two of them. Robin found himself enjoying the meal more than usual, and after guzzling down his first bowl in just a few minutes' time, he quickly asked for seconds, then thirds.

Letting the meal digest, Robin laid back on the log and relaxed, closing his eyes for a minute. When he opened them, Little John was standing over him, a perplexed look on his face. "Hey, Robin... have you looked yourself over lately?"

"Why's that, John?"

"Well, you should probably see for yourself..." Little John grabbed a nearby mirror and shined it on the fox. In addition to the ten pounds he'd put on earlier, Robin's dinner had contributed to another 25 pounds on his frame. No longer could the fox be called skinny, or even normal-sized. He had a bit of a paunch sticking out over the belt on his tunic, while his arms and legs were just a bit thicker than they had been before.

"What the heck happened, Robin? Did you have twenty-five meals today or something?", Little John queried.

"You know, I might know what the culprit is," Robin replied. "Earlier today I came upon a fat raccoon sleeping in the woods - twice the size of the Sheriff himself - and, figuring him to be part of the king's guard, lightened his pockets a bit. This-" he said, as he struggled to take off the necklace around his neck, finally succeeding after 10 seconds- "seemed to be a nice reminder of what I'd done, but it may have been a bit more than that. Seems to me that it's why I'm a bit less lithe than normal."

Both Robin and John marveled at the magic necklace, and after a moment, each told the other that they'd come up with a plan.
1553322222221122111.title: see what Little John cooked up for dinner...

choices: "We send it to him as a sign of peace."
15533222222211221111.content:
Robin was the first to speak up.

"John, you know how the Sheriff and his guards are so incompetent? As a bear of your... stature, would you agree that their heft would have something to do with that?"

"Well, Robin, I personally wouldn't say it affects me, but if they're less active and lazier, there's no question that their size would stop them from being effective guards," John replied.

"Do you think that would hold true for kings as well?"

"Robin, what are you... Oh, I think I get it... are you saying we should try to get this necklace to the prince? If he weren't able to travel the countryside, and he was content to stay in the castle all day... you're on to something here," John said.

"Glad to hear it. If we can get this necklace around John's neck, he'd balloon in size, and as he loves gold, it wouldn't exactly be hard to get him to wear it in the first place. And if he's as big as his bumbling guards, the townspeople will be much less scared of him," Robin said, quite excitedly.

"But how do we do it?"
15533222222211221111.title: Robin says they can use it to incapacitate Prin...

155332222222112211111.content:
Robin proposed that he and Little John infiltrate the ranks of John's guards so they can get easier access to the king. "That way, we won't have to worry about getting in and out quickly without being spotted - we can hide in plain sight, and they won't think any less of us."

Not wanting to waste such a brilliant plan, the two set into action. After resting for the night, the two spent the next day taking turns sneaking into the immediate area around John's castle, studying how the guards spent their time, what their responsibilities were, and most importantly, where they'd be able to snatch a few uniforms, so that they wouldn't have to risk making their own and getting caught.

When it was nearly sundown, Robin finally spotted an elephant guard enter a side room near the castle in his full uniform and leave wearing street clothes. "That's definitely the changing room," he thought to himself, before the sky darkened and he didn't have any other opportunities to continue his recon.

The next morning, the fox returned to the room, timing the distance between each guard's entry and exit and judging when the fewest guards were on duty. It took nearly all day, but about an hour to sundown, he finally had his opportunity. The entire day crew had left and the night shift didn't begin for another half-hour. Additionally, as the night crew was only about a third of the normal staff, there was no way they'd notice two measly uniforms missing.

Robin quickly sauntered over, a bag over his shoulder as if he was a regular peasant, and picked the lock to the room in seconds. Entering the guard's quarters, he saw about 50 uniforms hanging, with their range of sizes marked overhead from...
155332222222112211111.title: "We disguise ourselves as guards."

1553322222221122111112.content:
Though Robin had had a smile on his face when he entered the room, expecting there to be at least a few uniforms for normal-sized animals like himself, it fell when he saw the smallest size on the racks was extra large, and that the uniforms only went up from there. Taking a few minutes to poke around, he desperately searched for a smaller uniform, but it wasn't going to happen - it seemed Prince John liked his guards to be hugely fat, as so they'd be more imposing.

Confused as to what he could do in the situation, Robin pulled one of the XL uniforms on for a split second, to see if he could pass as a king's guard. It wasn't to be - the uniform's sleeves billowed out and he appeared to be a child playing dress-up when he looked at the chest. Realizing he had just a few minutes before the king's guard ended, he grabbed two uniforms off a rack, put them in his bag and quickly fled from the room, finding a safe vantage point about 50 meters away on the side of a building. He stuck around until the first night shift worker came in. The obese ram entered and exited the room in just about a minute, meaning the coast was clear and Robin's intrusion wasn't noticed. As the falling sun masked his tracks, the fox left the castle area and retreated back to his camp.

"How'd it go, Robin?", Little John queried as Robin entered.

"Fairly well," the fox replied. "I managed to take a few uniforms without being spotted, but the sizes weren't exactly to my liking. They'll fit you, but we might have to think of an alternate way to get me in as a guard."

As he described what had happened, Little John reached into the bag and looked at the uniforms. "Wow, now we know where John likes to spend the peoples' money," the bear said as he tried one of them on. "This thing feels great," he added, stretching in the uniform. Taking it off again and putting on his regular clothes, the bear paused for a second. "Hey, Rob, thanks for getting this 2XL, it fits me perfect, but why is the other one..."
1553322222221122111112.title: extra large to 5XL.

15533222222211221111122.content:
The fox winced when he heard what Little John said. "That's what I get for not looking at the sizes," Robin replied. "So what now? There's no way that thing fits me, and there's no way I'll be able to pass as a guard if I'm wearing it and it's so baggy I can barely step."

"Well, there's one way that it can fit you, Robin..."

"What's that?"

"Well, it doesn't fit you now, but you can make it fit you...", Little John started to say, pointing to the necklace, which was hanging on a nearby tree branch.

"WHAT? No. No, no, no, that won't do. I can't rightly do that," Robin said.

"Well, you don't have much of a choice, do you?", Little John replied. "You can't exactly waste another whole day sneaking this uniform back into the guards' quarters, and even if you did, none of the others would fit you."

"John, I don't think it's such a good idea."

"Robin, you're all about being selfless and altruistic. You risk your freedom, even your life, daily for the good of the people. Now you have an opportunity to possibly stop your most hated enemy and you're not willing to take it? What does that make you?"

"John, it's just..."

"Robin, it's your waistline or the kingdom, think about it."

Robin thought for a few moments, then realized John was right. It had to be done... but why did he have to slip up and grab such an outlandishly large uniform? "Ugh... well, you're right, John, we need to do it."

"Let's get down to business, then," John said, grabbing the necklace and handing it to the fox. Resigned, Robin put it around his neck, and the strange feeling he had initially felt putting it on returned. Right after, he decided to put on the massive 4XL uniform, which was intended for an animal at least three times his size, even counting the close to 50 pounds he had put on from the first time he wore it. "Now we need to get you some food and speed things along," John said. "Stay right here, I'll be right back."

As John ventured into the forest to forage, Robin sat down on a stump and absentmindedly batted the massive uniform around. Holding it out to its full extension, he sighed as he imagined how large he'd need to get for it to fit. He continued doing this for only about five minutes before John returned, an armful of apples, berries and nuts in his arms. "Rob, I've got your first course right here," the bear said, dumping the food next to the stump and returning into the woods to find more food. Feeling the effect of the necklace, Robin grabbed an apple from the pile and took a huge bite, crunching into it and savoring its juices. Over a period of about 15 minutes, he finished all of the fruit and nuts, pausing when he was finished and taking a glimpse downward at himself. The uniform still spread itself well beyond where his current weight lay, but when he grabbed two sides of it and pulled it back against his belly, Robin could see that his gut had grown.

Just another moment later, John returned with...
15533222222211221111122.title: 4XL?

155332222222112211111222.content:
Little John had worked out a deal with a local baker that he'd pay them a decent amount of gold and, in return, the baker would add some extra orders to their batches each time they fired up the oven. The baker was kind enough to send him off with all of their excess food that hadn't sold earlier in the day. So when Little John arrived back at the camp so soon after leaving, Robin wasn't prepared for what the bear with him.

Little John complimented Robin on finishing the pile of fruit and berries, then told him his second course was already ready. To the fox's surprise and dismay, Little John pulled a large sack from behind his back. In it were two loaves of bread, half a sheet of cornbread and about a dozen large sweet roles drizzled in honey. "C'mon, Robin, eat up," the bear said as he shoved a roll in the fox's mouth.

For more than an hour, Little John watched over the fox, making sure he ate every bite before he'd let him do anything else. Robin half-heartedly shoved bite after bite of bread and roll after roll down his gullet, and if he waited more than 30 seconds between, the bear would shove another piece of cornbread into his mouth. This gradually went on until Robin, feeling ready to explode and unable to keep his eyes open, took a bite that led to John cheering. "All right, Rob! You did it! In the morning, I'll go back to the baker and get your next meal. Until then, go to bed!"

Robin acquiesced willingly, content to slip into a deep, deep food coma, a grin almost forming on his lips while he grimaced at his full belly.

The next morning, Robin awoke as if he'd been asleep for a year, groggily coming to. He looked around to find John was gone - waiting for the baker, most likely - and in the meantime, Robin tried to stand up. Stunned at the size of what he could see in front of him, he ended up having to crawl onto his belly because he now weighed..."
155332222222112211111222.title: a large supply of sweets

choices: twice the food he'd brought before
twice the food... and Maid Marian
1553322222221122111112221.content:
50 pounds had been added to his body as he slept, Robin deduced, as he struggled to stand against his belly, which was jutting more than a few inches off his frame. In just a few days, the fox who had been skinny all his life was becoming overweight, and doing so quickly. When the fox tried to put his tunic on, changing out of his clown clothes of a uniform, he found it simply didn't fit anymore. The thing rode up to his waist, and his belly was fully accentuated as it had become stretched nearly to his limits. The belt on the tunic, when he tried to fit it around his waist, hung uselessly in two directions, unable to come close to meeting ends. Dejected, the fox changed back into the 4XL clothes, finding that he wasn't quite as swimming in them as he had in the past. Sure, the things were still at least four sizes too big for him, but he knew that would change as he continued to bulk up in the future.

Speaking of bulking up, John called out from the path - he had a surprise...
1553322222221122111112221.title: 225 pounds

15533222222211221111122212.content:
"Yoo-hoo, Robin, are you there?"

Robin froze when he heard that voice. John had brought Maid Marian here? While he was growing into a bloated excuse for a fox? He couldn't believe his misfortune and started to blush, just as Marian ran right up and kissed him on the cheek.

"Marian, what are you doing here?!", Robin sputtered, unable to believe that she'd still love the heavier him.

"Well, I was going to the baker's for a loaf of bread when I ran into John! I asked him where you had been for the last few days, and after pulling me aside, he told me the whole story! I can't believe how brave you're being, Robin, you're truly the hero we deserve."

At the edge of the camp, John called out, "I'm glad you two are on such good terms, but we've got work to do, Marian!"

"Oh! Right! We've gotta make Robin into a proper guard and fill out that uniform!", she teasingly said, grabbing Robin's belly for a split second. "So what are we waiting for? Here's your breakfast, Rob."

Marian unloaded a bag that was full of...
15533222222211221111122212.title: twice the food... and Maid Marian

155332222222112211111222122.content:
Once again, Robin was taken aback by the sheer size of the food load given to him. Marian's bag was full of massive sweet rolls, dripping with honey and sugar, each one nearly the size of a discus.

"When I heard Little John's plan with the baker, I threw in some of my own money so that we can make sure they're focused on your needs first! Here you go, Robin!" Marian then shoved the first roll she could reach into the fat fox's mouth, making sure he took a big bite and watching him gulp it down.

Very similar to the previous stuffing session, Marian and Little John kept watch over Robin for the next few hours, making sure that he finished one of the 24 sweet rolls every ten minutes without fail. By the end of the fourth hour, the rolls were depleted and the fox was quite bloated. In the course of the day, the fox's weight had skyrocketed another 75 pounds, pushing his overall weight to about 300 pounds. His body shook with every step he took, and from head to toe the changes were obvious. His second chin had begat a third, and his neck was shrinking, making his wider face more noticeable than ever. His chest was growing outward and his arms had become much more thick, to say nothing of his belly, which hung about a full foot off his frame. When Robin struggled back to his feet in the guard's uniform, there was clearly still some room to fill, but the garment now fit well enough that it didn't quite hang off his frame anymore.

The cycle continued like that for the next few days. Robin would sleep off a massive meal full of bread and pastries at night, and in the morning, Marian and Little John would be waiting with his next breakfast. The loads never again got quite as large as the two dozen rolls, but Robin fell asleep multiple nights in a row feeling like his stomach was about to explode. Creeping closer and closer to full fruition, Marian and Little John finally celebrated when Robin's form fully fit the guard's uniform...
155332222222112211111222122.title: two dozen jumbo sweet rolls

choices: "Thank you for such a dignified gift," he says as he puts it on.
"Have I ever met you before?", he asks as he calls for backup.
1553322222221122111112221221.content:
On the morning of the fourth day after Maid Marian had started joining in on the stuffing sessions, Robin yawned and slowly awoke, struggling to sit up and then slowly working his way to his feet, when he saw John and Marian celebrating about ten feet away.

"What's going on?", Robin said, before he himself felt it. The loose uniform, which had slowly felt a bit more form-fitting at the end of each day, wasn't loose anymore. In fact, it was slightly stretched across his belly and on his sides. He couldn't see himself fully, but the uniform - alternative shades of white, gray - suddenly felt like it belonged on him.

Robin had undergone a full transformation in the past few days. Slowly but surely, chins were added to his face as his neck shrank. His chest was exaggerated yet somehow unsagging, though his gut hung about two feet out and down as well, kept in decent suspension around his waist due to the fabric having a bit less room than expected. His arms were round and thick, hanging off themselves no matter how the fox positioned his arms. His legs, from what he could tell, were also massive, thunder thighs and then some, though he could barely see past his belly. His butt did jut out a decent amount, and its padding meant he'd never sit on an uncomfortable chair again.

"Well, we've done it," Robin said, still melancholy about his transformation. Though he eventually came around to the massive eating challenges that Marian and John pushed him through, he still knew that his days as a sneaky, lithe archer were over for at least the next few years. Some aspects of being fat were actually fun - he felt bigger and stronger, possibly thanks to the necklace's powers, and Marian was surprisingly flirty no matter how big his belly got or how wide he had become - but it was also a new and uncomfortable chapter for the vulpine. "What now, though?"

Little John, now a good 150 pounds lighter than the fox who he used to tower over, smirked. "Let's get this plan in action!", John said. "Our first step should be to infiltrate the king's guard. If Marian can decorate it well enough, if we package the necklace in the right way, we can say it was given to Prince John as a gift. Then we can just sit back and watch the lion keep getting bigger until he can't even get up, much less tax the villagers."

Little John and Marian then told Robin to kneel, to which he barely managed to oblige. His stomach shifted uncomfortably, hanging nearly down to the ground and out past his knees. It was very difficult to remove Robin's necklace - it seemed the thing takes more of a liking to its wearer the longer they wore it - but twenty minutes later, they had succeeded. Robin and John left to see where they could slip into the guards' ranks easiest, while Marian stayed behind to prepare the necklace in the right way.

A few days later, the plans had gone swimmingly. John and Robin would alternatively report for a different king's guard shift, explaining that they were new hires. They were even able to give false names without a second thought - the other guards were clearly in it for the paychecks, as well as the large feasts held for them at the conclusion of each shift. Robin in particular caught flack from these feasts, as the other guards scoffed that a fox had become big enough to join the guard. As such, they goaded him into eating massive portions each night to "keep up his figure," and while the gain was slow, he added another 20 pounds to his frame over the period of about five days. It wasn't very noticeable in context of his larger gain, but Robin could feel his uniform actually start to feel tight at times if he sat wrong or took in an entire deep breath.

It had finally become time for them to risk bringing the necklace to John himself. They both figured the lion would recognize their faces, but Robin's face was about four times wider than it had ever been before. As a result, the two figured he would be safe bringing the necklace to the king, and he had his chance the next day.

It was mid-day and Robin was about halfway done with his shift when he found he had been given direct guard duty outside of the king's quarters. He had been carrying the necklace in his back pocket. The necklace itself was inside a small box wrapped in a festive paper - a good enough design, Robin felt. When the fox had about an hour left on his shift, he summoned the nerve to knock on the king's door.

"Who is it?", the king called from the other side.

"Sir, your highness sir, it's one of your king's guard, sir. I have a gift to present to you," Robin stammered out, suddenly getting slightly nervous. What if the plan didn't work?

It took only a second for his worry to pass, though, as John excitedly tittered. "A gift for me? Come on in!", the greedy lion said.

Robin walked into the king's quarters with the most dignified walk he could manage, difficult in his newly-gained 470-pound body, and launched into his best attempt at a story as he walked up to the throne, kneeled at the lion's feet and presented the king with the necklace. "Sir, before I joined your guard I was but a simple farmer. When I was a boy, my mother trusted me with this necklace, and said that a previous king had saved her life when she herself was as young as I. She asked me, if I were to ever have the opportunity, to pass this necklace along to a great king, and so I give it to you."

Prince John paused for a moment, looking at Robin's fat face for longer than the fox was comfortable with, before finally saying...
1553322222221122111112221221.title: three days later (weighs 450 pounds)

choices: The Sheriff, and he wanted to find out why John was soon to be fatter than him.
Sir Hiss, and he wanted revenge against Robin and Marian.
15533222222211221111122212211.content:
Prince John thanked Robin for his gift, likely won over by the extremely exaggerated story the fox had concocted. It sickened Robin a little to say that John was great, or even a king in the first place, was "great," but he knew exactly how to press John's buttons, and had been successful with the plan - doubly so when the king immediately put the necklace on in front of him, presumably because of his lust for gold. "It's wonderful! Thank you... oh, what is your name again?"

Robin gulped for a bit before coming up with the answer he thought the lion would be even happier to hear. "Sir, you don't need to know my name, for I am just a humble guard in your employ, dedicated to the kingdom flourishing in any way possible," he said. The lion, predictably, was enthused from this story and thanked the fox once again.

As his shift ended, Robin snuck away from the guard's quarters as fast as he could. This plan - this crazy, nonsensical plan - had actually succeeded to a point. When he returned to the camp, which had been expanded a bit due to Robin's newfound girth, Marian and John were ecstatic as well.

Over the course of the next week, Robin stayed away from the kingdom completely, not willing to risk any encounters with the Prince, mostly spending time with Maid Marian. Little John, meanwhile, regularly reported to shifts, and over the week's time, he had great news whenever he saw the lion. After a day, the notably thin lion had fulled out his robes just a bit. Apparently between then and the third day he had enjoyed a few large meals, as his weight started to grow at a faster pace. By the end of the week, the lion had added more than 75 extra pounds on his frame. What was even better - he was surrounded by so many yes men and people eager to please that he wasn't noticing himself balloon up to become overweight, then push the limits of obesity. What's more, as he grew, he became more one-track minded, wanting more food and entertainment and neglecting to guide the king's guard to collect any taxes. The plan had worked!

However, in the middle of the night, a shadowy figure turned the espionage tables on the foxes and bear. But who had found out about their plan?

Hiss, the prince's loyal servant, hadn't noticed the lion's weight begin to rise until he required a new robe, then another the next day, going from a small to a large after just a few meals. Then he became suspicious, partly because it meant more work for him.

Hiss had remembered the king's run-ins with Robin and Little John, and while the former had become someone completely different in the past few weeks, John was still the same size as he usually was. Five days after John had received the necklace, Hiss had finally spotted John as a guard, and realized that the Merry Men had been responsible in some way for the king's rising poundage.

Hiss had finally found the group's camp on the night of the eighth day, which was convenient, as the Prince had decided he wanted a bath and told Hiss to take off the necklace so it wouldn't rust. The longer it took to remove it, the more Hiss was convinced of its magical qualities, and once it was finally removed and John had his bath, the snake hypnotized the lion to sleep and took the necklace with him.

At daybreak, the sounds of nature slowly but surely led the campers to wake up. The first to do so sleepily wandered to the outskirts of camp to take in some morning air, and that's when Hiss struck. Sneaking out in the open, the snake hypnotized ______ and made them follow him back to the castle.

"Oh, that's not much of a problem... ROBIN HOOD," Hiss said, and Robin became flushed with fear. Before he could run or fight, the snake caught him with his transfixing hypnosis.

"Robin Hood... you will put on this necklace," Hiss said, handing it to the fox. Robin complied immediately. Satisfied, Hiss continued, "you will follow me back to the king's castle," and began slithering back down the trail, Robin following him like a zombie. 15533222222211221111122212211212.content:
When Robin next knew where he was or what was going on, he woke up propped against a wall, with a chain around his left arm attached to a table in what appeared to be the castle's pantry. What's worse, he noted, was that Hiss and the newly-rotund Prince John were staring him in the face from across the room.

"Ah... Robin Hood," the king said, his stocky frame now imposing as the king displayed his disdain for his enemy. "I should have known such a suck-up of a guard wouldn't have been telling the truth," he continued, occasionally gnawing on a turkey leg he held in his right paw. "And you've won! To a point. You succeeded in making this king fairly regal, but I wouldn't want to be the only one having fun," he said with a smirk.

Robin shook his head and felt what he hoped he would never have to wear again around his neck. The magic necklace had made its way back onto his neck.

What's worse was that a veritable smorgasboard of food surrounded him, just within arm's reach. The king had gone all out in preparing this meal, ordering his cooks to prepare what must have been a dozen cakes, countless pieces of meat, loaves upon loaves of bread, and even pitchers filled with cream.

"Robin Hood, for an attempted attack against Prince John, you have been sentenced to hypnosis therapy," John said with a smirk as he turned and left the room, Hiss remaining right where he was.

Almost instantly, the snake used his hypnosis ability to catch the fox's full attention, and as much as he tried to fight, Robin gave in to his calls of "gluttony" and "eat" within a minute. The corpulent fox pulled the nearest cake he could reach on top of his belly, a chocolate one easily a foot wide. He immediately shoved a fistful of cake, then a second, into his mouth.

_______________________________

"Where could he be?!", Maid Marian cried out. It had been three hours since she and John had awoken, and Robin was nowhere to be found.

"Now, now, Marian, he can't be far," John replied, though he suspected Robin had been taken by the monarch's people. Telling Marian to return to her quarters, he sprung into action, using his position as a guard to search across the castle. Meanwhile, Marian herself started wandering around the area searching for Robin, knowing that because of her status she would rarely be questioned by anyone. Eventually...
15533222222211221111122212211212.title: Chained in a pantry in the castle (captured)

155332222222112211111222122112121.content:
Marian, having traveled much of the castle in an attempt to find Robin, finally entered the pantry after two hours had passed - five after Robin had initially vanished - and was shocked at what she had found. Sir Hiss continued to use his hypnosis on the fox, who had by now been eating under the spell for about four hours straight.

Though Robin had already been close to 500 pounds, Marian could see by the wear on his clothes - his guard uniform stretching and showing slight tears in some areas - that he had long since passed that total and was likely hanging around 600. His gut was even more pronounced but as he was still sitting against the wall, the width of the fox was what really took Marian aback - he was likely close to his height across at this point.

After she got over her initial shock, Marian was lucky enough that Hiss was too busy gloating about his fortunes to pay attention to the area. Grabbing a frying pan and sneaking up behind him, Marian gave a mighty swing and immediately took down the snake, who slumped to the floor. Shoving his unconscious body in a cabinet and locking it, she then ran to Robin's side just as he snapped out of the trance.

"What happened... oh, no," Robin said, realizing how much bigger he had grown. Struggling, slowly, over a period of several minutes, he finally made it onto unsteady legs, hampered by his belly which sagged to the ground. As he twisted to stretch (as much as he even could), things got worse - the uniform ripped and tore in three different areas, making him look foolish.

At this point, Robin didn't have many plots left before he'd lose his mobility entirely. Telling Marian to remove the necklace from his neck as fast as possible, he said that she needed to...

1553322222221122111112221221121211.content:
Robin knew that there would only be a certain amount of guards on patrol, but there was still a way to take down Prince John. If he and Little John managed to fight through the king's guards, they'd be able to corner the fat lion. As Marian was technically next in line for the throne, throwing a coup would actually be pretty easy once John was incapacitated in that light.

Of course, there was still the question of how they'd actually be able to get through those guards, many of whom were more than a handful to take on alone due to their size. However, as he slowly got used to controlling his bulk, Robin realized that if he could just stay on his feet and get some momentum, he had the ability to overtake more than a few large guards. If John wore the necklace too, the two of them would be a very formidable, albeit very fat, force to be reckoned with.

Marian agreed that this was likely the best course of action and left the pantry as quietly as possible to track down the bear. Meanwhile, Robin continued to figure out how to best use his immense body and kept watch in the pantry, especially making sure Hiss wouldn't alert anyone to the area by pulling him out of the cabinet, stuffing an apron in his mouth and tying it around his mouth to muzzle him, and re-securing him inside.

After about twenty minutes, Marian finally reappeared with John in tow, and though he seemed just as reluctant as Robin to get bigger, he put the necklace on. Robin had eaten a decent chunk of the massive feast laid out around him, but more than enough was left over, and John finally finished...

15533222222211221111122212211212112.content:
There was more than enough food left over from Robin's binge to take care of John, and he ballooned as time went on. He was never the skinniest bear, but there was still a clear and notable change in his appearance as time went on. His belly slowly but surely made its way out from underneath his shirt, and his belt only lasted about half an hour before popping off his widening waist. From hour to hour, he seemingly swelled up entirely, his entire frame growing stockier and wider as he went.

Eventually, after three hours had passed, John finished the last morsel of food. It showed. His height was the only thing preventing him from being a carbon copy of Robin's frame, as his extra few feet ensured that he was slightly thinner all around. Still, though, his belly's multiple feet in width and volume and his swelled, fatty limbs were more than formidable. He and Robin looked the two strangest fighters around, standing at a combined thousand plus pounds, but they were confident they could work their way through the king's guard without any issues.

Before John and Robin headed off to fight the king's guard, Marion stopped them. "To take on the entire king's guard, you're going to need more than just the two of you," she said. "I can help you! Let me join you."

John thought for a moment before responding. He said...

choices: The Sheriff stood before them with a grin.

1553322222221122111112221221121211211.content:
"Marion, you're going to need to be careful. If we somehow lose to Prince Johnny's men, we're going to need backup, and there's a good chance you'll be our only backup. We need you to stay behind us, be quiet and wait for us to need you. I know you want to get out there and back us up, but they'll get you in a split second right now. Me and Robby... well, we've done this a bit more. Here," he said as he took off the necklace, "hold onto this for us, so it doesn't fall into the wrong hands. And stay safe, we don't want to lose you."

Robin and John turned (slowly) to leave, but not before Marion gave her massive boyfriend a peck on the cheek for good luck. And with that, they were off.

The two 600-pound animals were on the third floor of the castle, which meant they needed to go three floors up to reach John's quarters, where he almost definitely would be with the vast majority of the kingdom's gold. Of course, the castle's layout was sprawling and extensive, with staircases located almost haphazardly in different locations. They had a path, but knew it might take some time to finish it before they could reach their final goal.

They had made it about a quarter of the way up to John's quarters when they finally ran into the first platoon of the king's guard - about half-a-dozen smaller, but still fat, animals under John's employ. It took about a minute for them to fend off the weasels, dogs and badgers coming toward them - surprisingly, their added weight made their punches extra powerful, making it easy to first knock back, then knock out, their opponents. Slowly, John and Robin became accustomed to fighting in their bulkier bodies, even bouncing the last unfortunate weasel standing between their bellies before finally letting him hit the wall at full speed, knocking him out.

As they progressed deeper, crossing one staircase and a hall before a second fight, then another hallway before coming upon a third, they noticed the king had layered his guards by strength. By the third platoon, they weren't taking on smaller animals anymore - the weasels gave way to bulls and pigs, then elephants and rhinos. Each fight took longer, was more difficult, and eventually left Robin and John puffing at their bigger size. At the foot of the fifth-to-sixth floor staircase, they were matched against two hippos, each one matching their weights - after a marathon 15-minute battle, which culminated in a makeshift tag-team sumo battle, they both nearly fell to the ground in exhaustion after finally defeating their enemies.

Finally, though, they were one door and one staircase away from confronting their final enemy, the prince, and finally ending his reign of tyranny. After pausing for several minutes to rest, the fox and bear finally rallied and opened the door, only to discover another obstacle in their path.
1553322222221122111112221221121211211.title: you should  watch our backs and use stealth

15533222222211221111122212211212112111.content:
"Well, well, lookie what we have here?", said the Sheriff of Nottingham, staring down his arch nemeses with a grin at the bottom of the stairs to Prince John's bedroom. "We've got Robin Hood and Not-So-Little John. Good to see you boys finally decided to put some meat on those bones, though you went a little far, huh? Y'all know that attempted treason is punishable by death in our little kingdom, right? While John's upstairs, I'm sure he won't mind if I'm your judge, jury and executioner."

The wolf stood in front of the two heroes. He, until very recently, was an even match for John and dwarfed Robin. Now, the bear didn't tower over him, but doubled his fram. Robin was even wider. Grinning, he drew a sword. "En garde, you thieves!"

The Sheriff began swinging wildly at John and Robin, who, despite their size and exhaustion, were able to dodge his swipes easily. After just a few seconds, John rushed at the wolf, knocking him back and getting the sword out of his hand, forcing him to fight them hand-to-hand.

Unfortunately for John and Robin, their former battles over the past several hours had left them unable to stand an extended battle, and though they tried to keep their feet, the Sheriff quickly gained the upper hand. Their swings were doubly slow due to both fatigue and their added size, and though he himself was by no means skinny, the wolf was able to dodge nearly all of them, only taking a few glancing blows. In contrast, the fox and bear struggled to avoid the wolf's swings and maneuvers - at half their size, he was twice as mobile. It took only a few minutes for a well-placed kick to knock Little John on his back - and the bear couldn't get up after, the extra weight holding him down. As he squirmed and shifted, trying desperately to regain his feet and get back into the fight, Robin and the Sheriff entered a lopsided fistfight. While low punches only bounced off Robin's massive belly, high blows were knocking the fox senseless. After a few more minutes, the wolf had exhausted Robin until he dropped to his knees, his entire body heaving as he gasped for air. The Sheriff sauntered over to his sword on the ground and lazily grabbed it, slowly putting it to the fat fox's throat. Robin faced the still-open door, hoping desperately for a savior.

"Robin Hood, you are hereby accused of attempting to overthrow the monarchy. How do you plead?"

"I'll... never... you... know... John is... corrupt..."

"What was that? Your new weight is making it hard to hear. I think... yeah, that's it, you said guilty, right? Well, Mr. Hood, do you have any last words?"

"I do," a voice rang over the wolf's shoulder. When the Sheriff turned to see who disturbed his victory, a fist came flying at his face. With one sweeping blow, the wolf was laid out, knocked unconscious immediately.

Robin looked up to see his savoir, and found it was Maid Marion. Thing is, something seemed different...
15533222222211221111122212211212112111.title: The Sheriff stood before them with a grin.

155332222222112211111222122112121121112.content:
As Robin looked up to see his lover, who had just saved his life, he gasped at the sight. It was the same old Marian, all right... with about 300 pounds on top of her. Her dress was stretched to its limits, her breasts and belly fully visible against its fabric. She looked much like Robin had earlier, during his marathon eating sessions.

"Marian? What happened? Why did you wear the necklace?"

"Well, Robin, I did what you and John told me - I used stealth. No one would want to say a word against me, so I walked in plain sight around the castle, only to see the forces of the king's guard growing at every checkpoint. I knew that if I didn't do anything, you'd find yourselves in big trouble. The two of you rapscallions decided to clear out the pantry when I returned to put on the necklace, but luckily, the dairy was next door, and the farmers had just completed a big treatment of heavy cream. A few hours of drinking later, and I followed the trail of defeated guards to find you two."

Robin jumped to his feet - well, as much as he reasonably could at this size - and embraced Marian, who had just saved his life. The two struggled to kiss due to their new sizes, which made them both laugh.

"Well, I can't say I'm happy with our new status, but we might finally be able to stop that old John now," Robin said.

Just then, Little John finally made it back to his feet. "Who's stopping me?", he joked.

At the same time, the three noticed the Sheriff seemed dangerously close to waking. "I'll take care of that," John said, and took a seat right on the wolf's stomach. He adjusted, making sure he wouldn't kill him, and motioned for Marian and Robin to finish the job.

After a slow, steady walk up the stairs...
155332222222112211111222122112121121112.title: It was around her neck...

1553322222221122111112221221121211211121.content:
The two foxes reached the top of the stairs to find Prince John cowering in the corner, surrounded by huge cakes and piles of pastries - he'd clearly been trying to gain more to possibly fend off any attack on him, but he'd failed. He was about 120 pounds fatter than when he'd first been exposed to the necklace, clearly obese but dwarfed by the much fatter vulpines, and knew he'd met his match. As Robin and Marian converged on him, he began giving them offers.

"Leave me and I'll pardon you, Robin! I'll make you second in command, Marian! I'll do anything, just don't take the crown from me! Here, you know what you'll love? This is a special cake," he said, pushing a small and intricately-decorated treat toward the foxes. "It was made specially for me by the bakers' coalition last month. They say it's made with the purest ingredients in the world and is the most filling food in the world. I'll give it to you free as a peace offering."

"Well," Marian said, "that does sound tempting." She walked over to the treat and ran her paw through the icing, scooping some up. "Ooh, that is good," she said. She reached in her pocket, pulled out the necklace and put it on before taking a full pawful and shoving it in her mouth.

Not breaking eye contact with the king, Marian ate the cake as fast as she could, taking sloppy handfuls and shoving them into her mouth. As the cake quickly disappeared, every bite seemed to make her stomach even bigger as she thickened all over. By the time it was finished less than three minutes later, Marian had grown another 200 pounds, nearly catching up to Robin. She took her much-bigger gut and used it to shove Prince John into the wall.

"You are going to step down from the monarchy. You are to leave this area for good. If you don't, Robin and I will see to it that you rot in jail for the rest of your miserable life."

Defeated, the lion nodded, and Marian backed off him. The lion morosely handed over the crown off his head, which Marian put on Robin's head. "As the highest-acting member of the king's monarchy, I declare Robin the temporary king," she said with a smile before the two massive foxes embraced in a hug. They'd finally stopped the tyrant.

15533222222211221111122212212.content:
'Oh cripes...' thinks Robin. Even the fox couldn't reconize himself in a mirror, not with a pot belly hanging down around his knees. How did the lion do it?

Little did the fox know that his antics would his constant thievery against the self imposed king and tyrant had driven John into the depths of parinoia, seeing Robin's shadow where ever he went even if he wasn't there, and his laughing face hounding the lion in his worst nightmares.

Oh, how many of his poor staff were jailed and sometimes even thrown to the gators in the moat simply because the king wanted to be sure they really were not the infamous vulpine in desquise.

And now, the thief really was here! In front of him! All though in all his years John would have never have thought he would come face to face with his mortal enemy like this.

"Robin? Is that really you?" The lion crossed his arms. A smug smile spreading across his face. "No wonder we couldn't ever find you. We will certainly have to update our wanted posters now, oh wait, no we wont! GUARDS!"

At the kings call the doors to the room open wide. Half a dozen rhino's flood the room armed with halberds.

The lion makes an estranged yelp as Robin draws his sword to defend himself. "Well, I think it's safe to say its time to leave."

The fox turns tail for the nearest window. Blocking a strike from a halberd to his left and tossing the accursed necklace into the face of a charging Rhino on his right.

"Sorry about the cost of printing up new wanted posters but I have no intention of staying around here!" The fox sbouted in his usual joyfull fashion, launching himself through the open window and....

..immidietly getting stuck.

"Oh blast..." the fox whined as he became wedged in the saddly, rather large window. Sbortly there after the famous thief is secured by the guards and forcefully removed from the window with a painfull amount of effort. Painfull to Robin's ego that is.

Poking his head from around a near by chair the kingly lion blinks in astonishment. "Did we...did we get him?" The king boldly stepped out of his hiding place. "We really got him! To think, all these years of plotting and scheming and all we had to do was throw food at the theif!"

"What shall we do with em?" One of the guards growled.

John smiled most wickedly, his normally nausely voice for the first time in a very long time sounded truely over joyed. Even more so than at tax time. Leveling a paw at the fox he yelled with delight, "_____"
15533222222211221111122212212.title: "Have I ever met you before?", he asks ...

155332222222112211111222122121.content:
"Take him to the dungeon while we figure out what to do with him," John said to the rhino guards, who immediately whisked Robin away. As they took the rotund fox to the jail, they interrogated him about the true meaning of his actions, and of the necklace. Though he held a poker face for a commendable time, the rhinos wouldn't stop pestering him with questions until he revealed why he tried to remove the necklace.

After their laughter had subsided, the rhinos grew quiet. "Wait, you're not joking?", one offered. To test the theory, once they got to the jail cells, they threw the necklace around Robin's neck and, his hands restrained, found it easy to test its magic by stuffing a pastry into his mouth. Sure enough, even with his large size, the fox noticeably grew a just-noticeable amount.

The guards were enthused by this development, and ran to tell John what they had discovered. Almost immediately, the call was sounded: instead of a traditional punishment, Robin would receive public humiliation to prevent him from ever stealing from the monarchy again. The news spread quickly and sadly among the town - Robin was to be held in a main room of the castle on public display. He would regularly be fed large portions and fattening foods.

Marian and Little John worked quickly to devise a plan once they first heard of the plan, but by then the fox had been brought out to a sizeable crowd. Over a period of a few hours, guards and cooks would alternatively bring Robin slabs of meat, pitchers of milk and heaps of sweets. Try as he might, the magic of the necklace eventually prevented him from turning down any of the food. As his eating quickened, so did his weight gain. His baggy prison clothes slowly swelled with extra weight. Each day, it seemed the fox gained 50 pounds, and if this kept up for long, he'd be too big to even move.

Marian and John finally devised a plan, but it found them taking a major risk. They finally struck...
155332222222112211111222122121.title: Dungeon Dangers

155332222222112211111222122122.content:
"Allow me the honor of removing thy enemies head sire." One of the rhino guards said with surprising ammount of glee. The fox's antics had ired the rage of more than the wicked king bit also the guards as well.

Robin looked up at the burly creature and his sharp and deadly sword. He had no desire to meet such a horrible fate let alone like a stuck pig in the presence of this...this pitifull creature that dared call itself king.

The fox's agility may have failed him but his wits were as sharp as ever.

"Does it look like I care HOW? Just stab him or...something!" the king cotinued. He cringed and cast a wary eye about the room, "His re-pulsive friends might be around any corner, waiting to save him!"

Despite the situation Robin felt himself smile at the kings parinoia. It was a pitty there was no truth to it...

So instead Robin gave the king his best smile, "Well, you COULD just finish me off like some common street thug. That seems a little..." Robin hesitated to think up of a word, "Kind of ordinary though. For uou I mean."

"Oh no you don't! I am wise to your slippery tongue...you are...you are just trying to stall for time! Guard!" The rhino behind him began to raise his axe.

"Stall for what? You caught me...fair and square. My gimicks failed and now I get to pay the price." Robin turned to the side and muttered something. The king leans forward, "Sorry, I did't catch your last words there."

Robin look miserable. Even though acting the words felt sour on his tongue. "You won."

"What? What did you say?" John looked...shocked. "I won." A twisted smile formed about his lips. "I won." He began to laugh. "I won....heh...heheheh...hahahhahah...I won! I won! I finally won!" He reached forward and grabbed the fox by the muzzle and shook his head about before releasing him, "You cheaky little rascal I won!"

"Yes yes. You won. Now its time to celebrate beyond a simple execution. You need something...something grand to go really strike fear in the hearts of the people." And something complex that will take time to set up and give me more time to plot an escape! Thought the fox.

"Your right. Blast you, your right. I can't just have you beheaded." The rhino in the back seemed to pout. He lowered his ax until it grazed on the floor as the king continued, "But how? How should I finish you..."

"You're clever. You'll figure it out."

"I AM clever." The king said smuggly, "How about...shot with arrows?"

"eh, too common."

"Right right. How about tossed from the battlements!"

John threw his arms wide, "Well it's not like I'm cruel enough to just turn you into a rug or something." The lion then paused, tail twitching as he stroked his chin. "Hiss...oh Hiss!"

"Y-yesss sire?" The snake said from near by.

"Am I cruel enough to turn someone into a rug?"

Robin gulped. This...was going differently than he had imagined it. "N-now John...don't you think...don't you think that is a bit extreme there. I mean really..."

Meanwhile hiss struggled to come up with a good explination for agreeing with the king with out calling him cruel. "Well...um...there isss no law againssst it. Well there isss sssire, but being the ruler..."

"Excellent! We can even do it here and right now! Just stretch the fox out and..." the lion made a slicing noise as he ran a claw from the fox's fattened belly to his chest.

Choosing his words...very carefully...Robin said to the lion, "Now John. We want to strike fear into the hearts of the people not...morbid dread! Do you...do you really think it wise to turn.." Robin had to swollow, "To turn me into a rug?"

Twirling his scraggly beard Prince John considers his options. "I suppose a King does need to show mercy every once in a while." Shooing the guards away with the wave of a paw be continues, "Toss him over the battlements and let the alligators in the moat take care of him."

"This is hardly merciful!" Robin shouts as the guard do just so! A large procession of guards drag the bandit through the many twists and turns of the castle before reaching the ramparts where they toss poor Robin over the wall wifh out much more flare than one tosses rubbish out the window.

The fattened fox hits the water with a loud SPLASH like a furry cannon ball. Contrary to popular belief the fat hardly floats when one has accumulated so much of it. It takes all of Robin's energy to pull himself back to the surface and swim for the far shore. To the left and to the right there are ripples in the water. Like sharks the gators close in on their struggling meal.

Robin puts up a most valient effort though, driven by the desire to protect Sheerwood Forest Robin swims on, straining each and every muscle, pouring out his last. For Little John, for the Merry Men, for the peasents, for Maid Merrian!

SNAP.

Robin's claws leave grooves on the mud of the shore line as he dissapears into the murky moat water. There is moment of frantic thrashing, as preditor and prey are locked in a battle of survival just out of view. The splashing water intensifies as two more gators join in the frenzy.

Eventually the waters calm. A trio of alagators emerge from the water, bellies bloated and dragging in the mud with their meal. One reptile rolls onto its back, rubbing its stomach with a content grin until it belches out Robin's hat.

THE END.

15533222222211221112.content:
"Let's face it, Robin, you've been getting closer and closer to getting caught every time you try to sneak around the king's castle. Remember that time you pretended to be a monk, but your fake belly fell out right in front of a guard? You could have been killed for that! I think it'd be best if you lied low for a little while, and this could help you. No one in the king's army would expect you to be fat - you could saunter up to Prince John himself and he wouldn't know the difference."

"John, I appreciate your concern, but there's no way I'm taking a break. The people need me. Come on, I'm taking this thing off right now."

Yet when Robin pulled at the necklace, it suddenly tightened around his neck, refusing to come off. The fox sat stunned for a few moments, wondering what to do.

"See? It agrees with me! Leave it on for a little while and take a break from near-death experiences," John said.
15533222222211221112.title: Little John says they can use it to help disgui...

choices: a tree bearing plenty of fruit.
1553322222221122112.content:
Unwilling to remain awake for even another few minutes, Robin decided that he'd just get a big breakfast in the morning, and immediately went to bed, not pausing to remove the necklace or even take off any of his clothes. Over the course of the night, the medallion around his neck continued to slowly do its work, and by the time the fox awoke in the morning he had seen another 10 pounds added to his frame. At this point, it would be hard for him to ignore the excess weight - he had the slightest frame of a belly that was visible underneath his belt. His tunic was still very form-fitting, though.

When he finally woke up, Robin was groggy at first, but was quickly brought to full alertness when his stomach let out a sudden, mighty growl. He clutched his abdomen in an attempt to stifle the sound, only to discover the slight paunch he had developed over the course of the last day. Where had that come from, he pondered, before a second growl reminded him that he had skipped dinner the night prior.

Setting off from camp quickly to grab a bite to eat, Robin still wasn't fully cognizant of his body's changes, and thought nothing of his sudden, extreme hunger. Over the next few minutes, he became one track minded, focused on finding a big meal. Eventually, he finds himself near...
1553322222221122112.title: head straight to bed...

15533222222211221121.content:
Out of the blue, Robin stumbled upon a strange tree that he had never seen before. It was at full harvest, with dozens of fruits hanging from branches and having fallen to the bed of grass below. Almost doubled over from hunger, the fox walked over to the tree's roots and grabbed a piece of the fruit. It appeared to be an orange, but it was much larger than traditional oranges were - one would barely fit in someone's palm. Deciding that now was as good as ever to have breakfast, Robin peeled the orange and took a bite, only for the sweet flavors to overwhelm his taste buds. The fruit felt strangely sugary in how sweet it was, but that made Robin just crave it more. He quickly finished the orange and grabbed another. Even stranger, he began feeling full after eating his third fruit, but he couldn't stop taking more and more. A half-hour passed as Robin ate orange after orange, finally finishing more than two-dozen of them around the tree.

After finishing, Robin felt tired, but didn't quite realize the toll the fruit had taken on his body.
15533222222211221121.title: a tree bearing plenty of fruit.

choices: The necklace continues to make him eat
155332222222112211212.content:
Shaking off the addictive nature of the fruit, Robin looked himself over only to be truly shocked by what had happened to him. Unbeknownst to him, the fruit was magic in a way that was amplified by the necklace, making it both effective and packed full of calories. This led to a major transformation in the fox's body.

His entire middle had thickened in every direction, rising as much at his belly as it did length-wise and in his rear. What he could see of his legs were much bigger. To make matters worse, his tunic was stretched out nearly to its maximum. Somehow, the magic fruit had made him nearly twice as large, adding 100 pounds to his body.
155332222222112211212.title: Gained 100 pounds (magic fruit)

choices: two dozen oranges, gained another 100 pounds
five dozen oranges, now weighs nearly 500 pounds
1553322222221122112122.content:
Just as Robin had deduced the fruit had played some role in making him gain so much weight, the necklace suddenly sent a shockwave of painful hunger throughout his body. "But I just ate all that fruit," Robin thought, before his hunger made him look back at the tree. Impulsively, the fox considered eating more oranges, then wondered why he would even think of that.

Which is when the necklace's magic started walking him back toward the tree, which still held dozens of ripe oranges ready for the picking.

Slowly at first, then more quickly, a completely hypnotized and controlled Robin continued to eat the oranges, first eating them in bites and then shoving as much in his mouth as he could get as time went on. He suddenly sympathized with the raccoon he had stolen the necklace from - there was some weird magic tied to the jewelry, and whatever it was, it was up to no good.

Eventually, the fox ate the last remaining orange, finally snapping out of his magic trance. It turns out...
1553322222221122112122.title: The necklace continues to make him eat

15533222222211221122.content:
Robin had stumbled across a kindly old sheep woman, who had assembled a small store out of a tent on the outskirts of the larger town. She bid the fox good morning, and explained her wares for the day. She had prepared several muffins and some regular breads, but what caught Robin's attention was her selection of pastries. She had made several different types - some large donuts, a few triple-chocolate muffins and, best of all, a small cake.

Before he could think about the words coming out of his mouth, Robin asked her how much it would cost for him to purchase all of her pastries for the day. She was taken somewhat aback at the direct query, but admitted she could let go of them for about 12 pieces of gold. In a flash, the fox presented the baker with 15, a total she happily accepted. She loaded the donuts, muffins and cake into a knapsack for Robin and wished him good day, shocked at her sudden payday.

At the same time, Robin scampered away from the city for a few minutes, coming to a huffing halt about five minutes after he had started running. His creeping bulk was the real culprit, but Robin figured he was just too hungry. Just as well, though, he had found himself before a secluded clearing, complete with a bed of leaves that the fox could relax in.

Plopping himself down on the ground, Robin's mouth started to salivate as he untied the knapsack.

Almost overtaken by his appetite, the fox took a big bite of a donut to begin his feast of a breakfast. He immediately tasted its deliciousness, as it was glazed and stuffed with sweet buttercream. Eating as fast as he could but slow enough to savor the sheep's delicious recipe, he finished the first donut and immediately turned to the remaining three. Each one was more delicious than the last - next he had a chocolate glazed stuffed with jam, then two covered with fudge.
15533222222211221122.title: a local baker.

155332222222112211222.content:
Robin burped and felt just as satisfied with his meal as he did when he would steal money back for the people. He paused for only a moment before wanting to continue his meal, grabbing one of his three muffins and examining it for a moment. It smelled heavenly and was so chocolatey that some of the frosting was sticking to the knapsack. Unable to restrain himself, the fox grabbed it and took a huge chunk of a bite, then another, wolfing down the muffin in mere seconds. In short order, he almost unconsciously devoured the second, then third, in just a few more.

Robin's next burp was deeper and more noticeable, and that snapped him out of his food trance for a second.
155332222222112211222.title: he's too hungry, keeps eating (gains 50+)

choices: "Robin!" Little John arrives and sees the plus-sized fox.
Robin seeks out the raccoon who he had stolen from
1553322222221122112222.content:
Looking around for a second, Robin kept his mind off food, just long enough to refocus on the cake he had just purchased. It wasn't incredibly large, maybe nine inches around, but it appeared to be thick with cream and sugar. The frosting on it was an even thicker chocolate butter, and when Robin took his first bite, he could not believe what his taste buds were experiencing. The cake was the most delicious thing Robin had ever tasted, and he at first only nibbled from one place and another. But those bites slowly gave way to appetite, hunger and greed, and the rest of the cake was gone in minutes, Robin blissfully leaning back into the leaves and falling into a blissful food coma with the last bite.

An hour later, he had awoken, the forest still as beautiful as it had been before, and sat up. Well, he tried to. He had an unfamiliar blockage on his lap when he tried to get up from his lying position, and rolled to his side, only to feel the heavy shifting of his stomach. Robin couldn't believe what he was seeing. Not only was his tunic riding up on him nearly up to his waist, but a large belly was lying where his svelte self used to be. Struggling to his feet, the now-portly fox stumbled his way back to camp, his weight unfamiliar under his frame. Eventually, when he got there, he went straight for his mirror to look himself over. He was stunned - his frame had literally doubled in the last 24 hours. That 20 pounds he had gained overnight was nothing compared to what happened with his huge breakfast, as his arms were tight in their sleeves and flabby outside of them, the red fur covering them making them look even bigger. Robin had a definitive second chin and the beginnings of a third one, and his belly hung as much as eight inches off his frame. His legs had widened as well, as had his hips.

Taken aback, Robin finally realized the properties of the coin he had stole, and sought to take it off his head. Strangely, he couldn't - he pulled and pulled for a second, but the string had shortened somehow since he had initially put it on, and the coin itself seemed almost magnetically attracted to him. The 250-pound fox started to worry and wonder about the fate he had put himself in.
1553322222221122112222.title: The cake is calling... (gains 125 pounds)

15533222222211221122222.content:
Robin realized that if the necklace was doing this to him now, it must also have made the raccoon he'd stolen it hugely fat as well. He set off to find the raccoon he'd taken it from, hoping he wouldn't be too mad at him for doing it.

It wasn't hard for Robin to find the raccoon, who was lingering near the edge of the town. Robin planned to start the conversation, but the raccoon noticed the fat fox and began walking over to him. Robin found the raccoon to be about twice his size, so he didn't want to fight.

"So you took the necklace and now you want help, right?", the raccoon asked. "Well," Robin stammered, "yes, I suppose so." The raccoon didn't seem angry so much as relieved. "Well, at least I know what happened to it, and that I'm safe," he said.

"What do you mean safe?", Robin asked. "It's cursed," the raccoon said. "Whoever wears it becomes a glutton and gets fatter by the day. It was given to me by a rival salesman in another town to spite me, and I couldn't take it off. When you found me, I'd fallen asleep from eating too much, and I was worried I'd get too big to move." "Is that going to happen to me?", Robin asked, shocked. "Dunno. I can tell you what I know about it, though. It..."

"So you're saying I have to keep eating for days and get hugely fat to break the curse?"

"I'm afraid so."

Aghast, Robin walked away from the raccoon, but his attention was quickly drawn to his growing hunger. Which he had just sated.

15533222222222112.content:
Tantor was walking through the jungle when he came across an abandon stone village, but the village looked different than any other he had seen before.

The streets were wider and the doorways where big and tall and could fit an elephant link him with no problems.

He had been a bit lost in his jungle walks, and he decided to through the place in hope that it would be a short cut back home. Little did he know that the village he had entered had a mystical powers on it, that would try to take and fatten up anyone that dared enter it.
15533222222222112.title: An adult.

155332222222221122.content:
As he wandered through the abandon place Tantor could see that it was a very old and "Aztec" like looking place. It also felt a bit "weird" in one way.

Weird in how something about it was affecting him.

The whole place had a big fog like aura covering it, making it hard for Tantor to know where he was. It also felt like the fog had some kind of effect on him as he was breathing it in.

And there was some weird looking fruit growing everywhere. On walls and old houses overgrown by ivy there was these purple looking squash shaped fruits. Even though they didn't look like the most safe things to eat, there was a bit of an "interesting" smell from them that was dragging Tantor towards them.

What of these things would make him fatter?
155332222222221122.title: Tantor gets lost in the village and is fattened...

1553322222222211222.content:
What Tantor wasn't knowing was that this wasn't any ordinary fog. This fog had a bit of a special "thickness" to it.

It was containing some kind of "fat" related particles that was making the fog very hard to see through, but that wasn't the only thing it did. Those particles also made anyone that was breathing them in get the "fat" part of them on themselves, making them slowly gain weight by doing nothing but breath.

Given that he was an elephant and was already weighing around 10,000 pounds Tantor at first didn't notice himself adding on some extra pounds, but as he walked around clueless for hours in the place he did start to feel that it was harder to take new steps.

Trying to turn his head around he could feel that his neck felt a lot thicker, and harder to move. Once he could see behind himself he noticed that his stomach was a lot rounder then before, and hanging down very low. His butt was much more wider now, and even his trunk on his face felt fatter and heavier to use.

"I must have gained at least 400 pounds since I got here! But how?" Tantor asked himself as he heard something from the distance.

Looking back in front of him he noticed a shadowy shape come towards him in the fog. Looking closer he could see that it had to be a gorilla, and when he heard the gorilla say "Hey! Tantor!", he knew it had to be Terk.

Once Trek got out of the fog and came face to face with Tantor, he could see that...
1553322222222211222.title: The thick fog that will make YOU thick.

15533222222222112221.content:
As the female gorilla came out from the fog the elephant could see that she was still around the same "thin" size of before. (Knowing that all gorilla's are somewhat chubby in shape.)

"What are you doing here Terk?" Tantor asked. "I was just about to ask you the same thing, but what has happen to you?" Terk asked, surprised to see her friend suddenly gained so much weight. "What do you mean?" Tantor asked pretending to not know, feeling a bit embarrassed over how he looked. But he could see in the face Terk was giving him that trying to hide his extra weight was down right impossible.

"You know what I mean." Terk said and poked the soft elephant belly fat with her finger. "I seriously don't know! Ever since I got here I have been trying to find my way out, and somehow that has left me ending up like this." Tantor said, sounding scared over the thought of him continuing to gain without a way to stop it. "Well, at least I know how to make sure to keep my body in shape..." Terk said before patting herself on her stomach, and getting a big soft "pat" back. Looking down she saw that she also had got a bit of a gut that wasn't there moments ago.

"Okay. This place is freaking me out!" Terk said, not believing her own extra paunch that she now had. "If only there was a way for us to get out of here." Tantor said, whimpering. Seeing a big tower like building shot up through the fog roof gave Terk an idea. "I will get up there, and see where the closest exit is." She said before starting to climb the thing.

As Tantor waited down on the ground, Terk made her way up to the top of the tower. Being an experienced climber should mean that she could do this without any problems, but with her new hanging belly getting in the way sometimes was giving her more of a challenge. And that wasn't all. The extra weight was making her tired much more easily, forcing her to make several stops on the way up. And given the rule of the fog making you fatter for every single little breath you take, you can only imagine how much Terk's big breathes of air was affecting her.

After much climbing Terk finally reached the top and could for the first time get a really good look over the place. It was much larger then what she remembered, but thanks to the great height of the tower she could see that a few miles away in the west from where they were there could be seen a great line to where the city ends and the jungle starts. "If we just go in that direction all the time we should reach it fairly quickly." Terk thought as she was making her way down again.

Even thought getting down was easier then getting up it didn't feel like that to Terk, and that was mostly thanks to the many extra pounds she had gained under her climb. And as she was climbing down sometimes she nearly lost her grip as the heavy weight of her body was pulling her down. She felt like she was that lazy male of the gorilla pack that did nothing but eating bananas all day and getting really fat. "This must be how it would have probably looked if he had to climb this." She thought as she was getting down.

Once she reached the bottom back again Terk now (Thanks to the fog) had been gaining...
15533222222222112221.title: Terk is still at her normal size.

She also felt her arms and legs being less muscular then when she started, and her chins and neck felt a lot more swollen around her head. Looking at Tantor (Who himself had been gaining another 50 pounds while waiting) Terk felt a bit embarrassed looking so out of shape in front of her friend.

"Did you see where the nearest exit was?" Tantor asked.

The question helped Terk get back to reality, and she told him that if they just focused on going to the west from where they stood they would find the jungle again. "Should just take us a 10-15 minutes to get out of here." Terk said as she lead the way, with Tantor following her.
